Job Description
OBJECTIVES/PURPOSE
Data Scientists within the Insights & Analytics team of the Applied Data Sciences & Learning organization will be accountable for driving the development of descriptive, predictive & prescriptive analytics to generate insights to solve challenging business problems. Data Scientists will work with multi-disciplinary teams to understand business needs and develop analytic & model outputs that are translatable into actionable business insights. This is a hands-on role, and the successful candidate must be comfortable working in an agile environment and capable of leading delivery at pace.
ACCOUNTABILITIES
Collaborate with a diverse set of users and partners across multiple functions to translate unstructured, complex business problems into appropriate data, modelling and analytical solutions.
Lead innovation projects through the data, analytics & machine learning lifecycle.
Clearly and objectively communicate results, as well as their associated limitations.
Apply and maintain methods, techniques and developments in analytics and data science.
Mentor and support other data scientists across multiple projects to drive the development of data science as a capability.
Develop & review working practices to ensure that data science work is delivered to robust quality standards.
CORE ELEMENTS RELATED TO THIS ROLE
2-6 years of experience in data science in the Life Sciences sector (Pharmaceutical / biotech. / medical device companies, healthcare payers and providers etc.) working with data from varied sources and types (RCTs, RWD, Digital devices, imaging, audio etc.). Level flexibility available based on experience.
Expertise in data cleaning, & pre-processing methods to normalize data.
Extensive experience with database querying (SQL), manipulating and analyzing large, high dimensional, structured, & unstructured datasets.
Experience in code management, version control, cloud computing infrastructure (e.g., AWS).
Expertise with programming languages (Python, R, Julia etc.) and visualization tools.
Proficiency with unsupervised, supervised, & reinforcement machine learning methods.
Expertise in one or several areas of AI (natural language processing, graph theory etc.).
Familiarity with deep learning frameworks, such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Understanding of algorithm design, development, optimization, scaling and application.
Excellent written and verbal communication, business analysis, and consultancy skills.
DIMENSIONS AND ASPECTS
Comprehensive understanding of the Life Sciences sector (Pharmaceutical / biotech. / medical device companies, healthcare payers and providers etc.).
Leadership
Demonstrated ability to work across functions, regions, and cultures
Excellent communicator, able to persuasively convey both ideas and data, verbally and in writing
Proven skills as an effective team player who can engender credibility and confidence within and outside the company
Embraces and demonstrates a diversity and inclusion mindset and role models these behaviors for the organization
Invests time in helping others to enhance their skills and perform at a higher level

Decision-making and Autonomy
Decision-making responsibilities:
Ability to seek diverse input from multiple constituents and stakeholders to drive innovative solutions
Interaction
Cultivates a broad network of relationships throughout Takeda, with affiliates and external partners, in the industry and area of expertise.
Ability to build strong relationships and collaborate effectively with other interfacing Takeda functions
Innovation
Comfortable challenging the status quo and bringing forward innovative solutions
Identifies opportunities and anticipates changes in the business landscape through an understanding and ongoing assessment of the environment affecting the business.
Complexity
Ability to work in a global ecosystem (internal and external)
EDUCATION, BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES AND SKILLS:
Essential Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, or another quantitative field.
Desirable:
Masters / PhD. in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, or another quantitative field.
In accordance with the CO Equal Pay Act, Colorado Applicants Are Not Permitted to Apply.
This position is currently classified as “hybrid” in accordance with Takeda’s Hybrid and Remote Work policy.”

Job Description
At Takeda, we are a forward-looking, world-class R&D organization that unlocks innovation and delivers transformative therapies to patients. By focusing R&D efforts on four therapeutic areas and other targeted investments, we push the boundaries of what is possible in order to bring life-changing therapies to patients worldwide.
Join Takeda as a Data Scientist, Human Factors and User Research where you will design, build, and deploy data structures, algorithms, and databases to support medical device and combination product design and development. You will also combine skills in behavioral research, statistical methods, qualitative methods, and general programming to optimize user-centered design. As part of the Human Factors and User Research, you will report to Sr Manager-Lead Human Factors and User Research.
How you will contribute:
Manage qualitative and quantitative use insights and Human Factors data
Develop and manage data structures and databases
Build automated decision support systems for Human Factors and User Research
Develop predicative models to enhance user-centered design
Automate data codification and verification
Develop applications to visualize and curate data
Generate data reports and dashboards
Integrate data science methods to support user insights gathering
Develop data-driven use behavior models
Support product and system level requirement generation and feature prioritization
Collaborate in a multi-disciplinary team environment
Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree and 8 years of Data Science, Data Engineering, Statistics, Industrial Engineering, Bioinformatics, Computer Science, or other relevant degrees or
Master's degree and 6 years of Data Science, Data Engineering, Statistics, Industrial Engineering, Bioinformatics, Computer Science, or other relevant degrees or
Doctorate degree and 4 years of Data Science, Data Engineering, Statistics, Industrial Engineering, Bioinformatics, Computer Science, or other relevant degrees
Expertise in data automation and coding for data manipulation is required
Fluency in at least one statistical programming language (E.g., R, Python, or similar) is required
Hands-on experience using at least one data visualization tool (E.g. Tableau or similar) is required
Understanding of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) models is preferred
Understanding of Augmented Reality (AR) is preferred
Expertise in product development process is preferred
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
This position may require 5 - 10% yearly travel, including domestic and international.
What Takeda can offer you:
Comprehensive Healthcare: Medical, Dental, and Vision
Financial Planning & Stability: 401(k) with company match and Annual Retirement Contribution Plan
Health & Wellness programs including onsite flu shots and health screenings
Generous time off for vacation and the option to purchase additional vacation days
Community Outreach Programs and company match of charitable contributions
Family Planning Support
Flexible Work Paths
Tuition reimbursement
More about us:
At Takeda, we are transforming patient care through the development of novel specialty pharmaceuticals and best in class patient support programs. Takeda is a patient-focused company that will inspire and empower you to grow through life-changing work.
Certified as a Global Top Employer, Takeda offers stimulating careers, encourages innovation, and strives for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world.
This position is currently classified as "hybrid" in accordance with Takeda's Hybrid and Remote Work policy.

In accordance with the CO Equal Pay Act, Colorado Applicants Are Not Permitted to Apply.
#LI-SB1

Company Summary
Join a team that puts its People First! As a member of First American’s family of companies, Data & Analytics is a national provider of property-centric information, analytics, risk management and valuation solutions. First American maintains and curates the industry’s largest property and ownership dataset with over 7 billion document images. Our major platforms and products include: DataTree®, FraudGuard®, RegsData™, TaxSource™ and ACI®. The First American Data & Analytics division boasts more than 20 patents and remains at the forefront of innovation - leveraging technology and data to deliver best-in-class decisioning solutions. Fueled by our industry-leading data and using our technology and proprietary process, our solutions provide lenders, real estate and title companies with actionable insights - enabling them to make better, increasingly automated, decisions. With offices in all major metropolitan areas, including California and New York, DNA teams work collaboratively from across the country. Since 1889, First American (NYSE: FAF) has held an unwavering belief in its people. They are passionate about what they do, and we are equally passionate about fostering an environment where all feel welcome, supported, and empowered to be innovative and reach their full potential. Our inclusive, people-first culture has earned our company numerous accolades, including being named to the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for seven consecutive years. We have also earned awards as a best place to work for women, diversity and LGBTQ+ employees, and have been included on more than 50 regional best places to work lists. First American will always strive to be a great place to work, for all. For more information, please visit www.careers.firstam.com.
Job Summary
Remote Candidates Welcome!!
We have an exciting role for a Data Scientist to help build and solve some of the most unique, interesting and challenging questions related to Natural language processing (NLP) utilizing a variety of Machine learning and deep learning techniques within Artificial Intelligence. The role will present opportunities to work on large datasets and the ability to use innovative techniques in Artificial Intelligence ranging from various NLP methods, computer vision, and deep learning to enable solutions that will be directly impactful to our customers. The solutions that you will POC, obtain feedback, quickly turnaround, iterate, story tell and integrate the model in a production pipeline will be a key success criterion for this position. You will completely own and manage the solution and collaborate with key product groups to provide innovative ideas and solution that are impactful and add immediate value.
Responsibilities
Use consultative approach to understand business problems and build solutions in an iterative manner.
Works with product teams to identify opportunities for Machine learning Deep learning and computer vision models to enable key success criteria.
Perform end to end activities within the data science life cycle from business problem understanding, exploratory data analysis, feature engineering, model training, model evaluation, visualization and deployment.
Within an NLP problem able to design and implement all components of the solution starting from understanding the data set, document balance, modern tokenization techniques and utilize deep learning models and tune model parameters to achieve optimal model scores.
Utilize Machine learning to identify pattern and anomaly in data sets.
Proactively research, prototype and present ideas to senior management in areas of machine learning, deep learning and computer vision that are directly beneficial and impactful to business use cases.
Participate and mature the data science framework with industry leading tools like Azure ML best practices and community of learning.
Knowledge and Skills/Technology Used
Experience with state-of-the-art techniques within NLP and utilized transformer based models and tokenization schemes for NLP tasks.
NLP project experience using pytorch, tensorflow, FASTai, spacy, huggingface transformers models.
Coding experience with several languages like Java Script, Python,, etc.,
Very good experience of querying databases (SQL)
Typical Education
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a related quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics or Computer Science
Master’s or PhD degree preferred
Typical Range of Experience
5-7 years of related work experience building predictive and descriptive statistical models

What You Will Be Doing
Collect relevant data to develop credit and fraud risk as well as servicing and collection models utilizing statistical techniques such as logistic regression and other machine learning approaches, i.e., random forest, and gradient boosting.
What You Need for this Position
Responsibilities:

Conduct data analysis to optimize the underwriting policies in how model scores, business, and credit bureau rules work together to produce desired financial performance.
Prepare model development documentation and update policy documentation.
Prepare ongoing model performance monitoring reports and provide recommendations when performance deteriorates.
Support data vendor evaluation in preparing raw data, and analyzing appended bureau data in predicting credit and fraud risk.
Perform other ad-hoc analysis as it relates to modeling and policy

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative subject. (Mathematics, Economics, Statistics preferred).
1-3 years experience preferred or relevant internship or course experience in the analytical or financial services field (both are highly preferred).

So, if you are a Data Scientist with credit/lending experience, please apply today!
Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Frontier Psychiatry is a telepsychiatry practice dedicated to serving communities in rural and frontier settings across Montana. As the largest psychiatric practice in the region, our team cares for patients across the care continuum and partners with a wide range of stakeholders, including state-run, non-profit, and for-profit organizations.

Our mission is to make high quality psychiatric care accessible to all Montanans by 2025. We’ve come a long way since our launch in 2020, but we have a lot of meaningful and inspiring work to do to get there. Frontier Psychiatry has been publicly recognized for its healthy work culture and for its innovative approach to care delivery. Frontier Psychiatry is led and owned by its two founders, Eric Arzubi, MD and Reza Hosseini-Ghomi, MD.

We are seeking a Part time Data Scientist to assist with business analytics for our telehealth company. Candidates must be able to utilize data from multiple sources including our EHR, finance software, HR software, and others, and build intuitive visualizations to measure our quality and progress. We want to demonstrate quality for value-based contracts with our payers (insurance companies) and measure company performance. Candidates must have experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights and be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes. This is a unique opportunity to work with a premier telepsychiatry company at the forefront of care delivery, reaching the most vulnerable and providing the highest quality care using innovative tools.

Core Responsibilities:

Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes.
Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality.
Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.

Qualifications for Data Scientist Position:

Applicants must have 5-7 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models, have a Master’s or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field, and is familiar with the following software/tools:

Coding knowledge and experience with several languages: C, C++, Java, JavaScript, etc.
Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc.
Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python, SQL, etc
Experience using web services: Redshift, S3, Spark, DigitalOcean, etc.
Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.
Analyzing data from 3rd party providers: EHRs, QuickBooks, HR software, etc.
Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Splunk,Map/Reduce, Hadoop, MySQL, etc and experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using: Splunk, ggplot, etc.
Strong problem solving skills with an emphasis on product development.
Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets. Experience with AWS, Splunk desired.
Experience working with and creating data architectures.
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
Advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.

This is a part time position with flexible work location and hours with the potential opportunity to become a fulltime position with company offered benefits.

Fulltime Benefits are:

Company paid insurance: Health, Dental, and AD&D
401k with company match
Generous paid time off, sick time, and paid holidays
Awesome perks & more!

Description
Metric5 is currently seeking a Data Scientist to work within a team providing Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence services to our government customer using Agile scrum processes. As a Data Scientist you. You are a go-getter with exceptional analytical skills, detailed oriented, self-sufficient, organized, and able to present information in user-friendly language.
Program Details
The program you will be supporting has a mission to provide development, security, and operations (DevSecOps) support to U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) with a focus on development, operations, and modernization of the Agency’s Enterprise Data Warehouse/Data Lake. The team utilizes open-source, AWS Cloud, and Big Data technologies, agile project management practices, and modern DevSecOps delivery to provide the business intelligence support systems to meet the reporting, data analytics, and machine learning/artificial intelligence needs critical to USCIS leadership, data/business analysts, data scientists, and other decision-makers.
Requirements:
Find patterns and trends in datasets to uncover insights
Create algorithms and data models to forecast outcomes
Use machine learning techniques to improve the quality of data or product offerings
Communicate recommendations to other teams and senior staff
Develop models, using machine learning, or incorporating advanced programming to find and analyze data
Perform data analysis, data verification, data validation, and testing from data ingested from source systems into the Big Data Environment
Stay on top of innovations in the data science field
Verify data quality to ensure accurate analysis and reporting
Interact with officially designated product owners, system owners, and business owners of the source systems to understand transactional system data models, requirements, and ETL logic
Contribute to an environment of continuous improvement by helping the team identify areas of the development process that can be improved and helping the team commit to and deliver improvements in those processes
Actively participate in Agile release and sprint planning, sprint grooming, artifact creation, sprint testing, demonstrations and retrospectives and solution releases.
Execute other activities related to development work, such as participate in meetings, provide briefings, presentations and other support materials that will promote the program, assist in achieving user buy-in, and explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Required Skills:
Advanced understanding of Data Science/Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence
3+ years performing data science work in Big Data environment. Experience in Data Warehouse/Lake environment preferred
5+ years of demonstrated experience with Apache Spark.
3+ years of proficiency with programming languages including Python, R, SQL and SAS
Excellent analytical, verbal, and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.
Ability to triage issues, react well to changes, work with teams and ability to multi-task on multiple projects
Strong problem solving and analytical skills demonstrated by the ability to assimilate new information,
Well-versed in the use of Microsoft Office Tools
Desired Skills:
Knowledge of Agile, including Scrum and Kanban, and management tools (e.g., Jira, Confluence)
Experience working in an AWS Cloud environment
Experience with industry standard version control tools (i.e., Git)
Education: Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline preferred – Computer Science, Mathematics, or equivalent technical degree, or the equivalent combination of education, professional training, and work experience.
Clearance: Must be a US Citizen and be able to obtain a government agency Suitability Clearance. USCIS Entry on Duty (EOD) preferred.

The CIB Marketing and Communications Analytics Team leverages data and analytics across J.P. Morgan, to build meaningful insights for our marketers, which provides value to our clients and enhances competitive advantages for our businesses. We have a strong partnership with our dedicated technology partners, who provide us with our cutting-edge data and analytics infrastructure. This is an opportunity to bring your data expertise and combine it with all aspects of a rapidly evolving B2B Marketing Analytics landscape within CCB Data & Abalytics

You will work with stakeholders across the organization to support and optimize our marketing strategy based on what is important to our clients. You will have the opportunity to develop and apply a variety of machine learning and predictive algorithms and influence the long-term evolution of our data science roadmap. You will need to be entrepreneurial, able to deal with ambiguity and work in a highly collaborative environment. You will identify specific and actionable opportunities to solve business problems and collaborate with multiple marketing teams to drive change. You need to be a sophisticated user of advanced quantitative techniques and data visualization, and an expert at synthesizing and communicating insights and recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences. You will also focus on exploring and prioritizing experimentation hypothesis, personalization and use-cases that could drive valuable insights.
More responsibilities:

Have a unique combination of technical skills, storytelling ability, and intuition to understand what is happening to data from inception to model to business decision.
Onboard and leverage machine learning models and techniques to target opportunities and optimize processes.
Analyze client data to identify segments in order to enable look-a-like audience comparisons based on expected performance and engagement.
Design and implement highly scalable and reliable data processing pipelines and perform analyses to drive and optimize business results
Analyze drivers of marketing performance to understand the relative impact of opportunities, behaviors, and effectiveness on acquisition and deepening outcomes.
Overlaying client and channel behaviors to determine how to drive personalization, optimize engagement and identify opportunities for cross-sell and upsell.
Design, execute, and measure the results of large-scale experiments in partnership with marketing, product and sales teams.
Partner closely with the business, analytics and technology teams to scale programs.
Support the aligned Data & Analytics lead for their products by identifying data required to be integrated into analytics platforms to support projects such as analytics, machine learning and artificial intelligence.
Qualifications:


7+ years' experience working as a Data Scientist
Experience applying various machine learning techniques and understanding the key parameters that affect their performance
Predictive modeling/analytics and algorithm development Expertise required
Data scripting languages (e.g. SQL, Python, R etc.) or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R, SAS, or Matlab) expertise required
Experienced in using multiple data science methodologies to solve complex business problems
Experience leading, analyzing and interpreting experiments for business use cases
Exceptional interpersonal and collaboration skills, ability to convey complicated mathematical concepts, algorithms and data structures simply with an ability to influence business partners

Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

Chase Consumer & Community Banking (CCB) serves nearly 66 million consumers and 4 million small businesses with a broad range of financial services, including personal banking, small business banking and lending, mortgages, credit cards, payments, auto finance and investment advice. The Decision Sciences organization is a centralized analytics function within CCB that supports each sub-line of business with a broad range of analytics, modeling, and strategic support. The Branch Operations Analytics organization sits within Consumer Banking Decision Sciences and supports the retail business to influence the capture of new data to be used in the broader analytics community, and analysis on the performance and adoption of new employee-facing technology, such as tablets, being rolled out to our branch network.

The Branch Operations Analytics organization is looking for analytical and business-minded Associate with strong report design, visualization & analysis skills. This team supports the Branch Operations Product team, which is responsible for technology in our branches, and this role will primarily focus on supporting these applications. These applications are becoming an integral part of the customer experience in our branches and are used to manage the lobby and quickly service customers, leading to an overall improved employee and client experience. Our team works closely with Business & Technology partners to:
Developing key data capture requirements for new branch applications or features so that information can be available in our central data warehouse for the benefit of the business and entire analytics community
Design impactful visualizations using tableau to provide trends and insights with the ultimate foal of driving wider adoption
Lead/consult as a subject matter expert on this data so that other analysts and stakeholders can leverage the information for a more understanding of the customer experience in our branches, beginning in the lobby
Design reporting packages and KPIs to provide data at the network and branch level to highlight top performers and areas of opportunity
Support key business initiatives including business cases to fund the build out of new functionality and applications

The ideal candidate would have significant expertise in extracting data, synthesizing it to draw insights, and be comfortable presenting findings to key stakeholders. This position will support key Consumer Bank Leadership including the Chief Administrative, CCB Decision Sciences, as well as other CCB lines of business. This position requires heavy/advanced use of SQL and Excel, with additional experience in other data tools preferred (e.g. tableau, Alteryx Python, R, etc.).

Key Responsibilities :
Lead data mining, aggregation, and analysis to advance branch tablet application development, performance, and adoption
Design visualizations to satisfy business questions, highlight trends and areas of opportunity
Effectively cultivate relationships with technology and business partners to provide guidance on data capture requirements and develop KPIs
Become a subject matter expert on branch tablet data, and be a consultant on this data within the analytics community
Monitor employee and customer transaction patterns and migration towards tablet servicing
Coordinate with functional partners and other CCB LOBs to address ad-hoc data requests and ensure stakeholder analysis needs are met

Qualifications:
BS/BA in an analytical field (e.g., business management, engineering, math, finance, economics, statistics)
Strong quantitative, critical thinking, and analytic skills with capacity to listen to stakeholders and recommend the best data points, metrics, or analysis to satisfy business questions.
5-7 years of professional experience with 3-5 years of experience an analytical/strategic role (e.g. reporting/data mining, technology, analytics or finance); financial services experience preferred
Strong problem solving skills, with the ability to find data solutions to respond to business needs.
Strong communication skills, comfortable creating summaries and recommendations to present to stakeholders, with ability to influence multiple stakeholders
Excellent relationship management skills and ability to navigate a large, complex organization
Intellectually curious, customer-obsessed, team-oriented, and high energy with passion for driving quantifiable business results
High Proficiency in Excel and SQL (or comparable programming language) required. Required. Tableau (or other visualization experience) and Alteryx (or other workflow management experience) are desirable.

Piper Companies is seeking a Remote Data Scientist/Analyst with Consumer Banking and/or Financial Services experience.

Summary
The primary purpose of this job is to support end-to-end development and implementation of credit risk monitoring and analysis in Consumer Lending space. This include automated and judgmental decisioning, credit policies for new account acquisition approve/decline, line assignment and portfolio risk management in Credit Card, Direct & Indirect Auto Loan, Unsecured Personal Loan & Line of Credit and Student Loan.

Essential Functions

Drive monitoring and analysis of credit risk for both organic and acquired portfolio, prepare related management reporting package and provide insights on root causes, emerging credit trends and implications on Allowance for Loan Losses.

Job summary
Amazon Advertising is one of Amazon's fastest growing and most profitable businesses. Amazon's advertising portfolio helps merchants, retail vendors, and brand owners succeed via native advertising, which grows incremental sales of their products sold through Amazon. The primary goals are to help shoppers discover new products they love, be the most efficient way for advertisers to meet their business objectives, and build a sustainable business that continuously innovates on behalf of customers. Our products and solutions are strategically important to enable our Retail and Marketplace businesses to drive long-term growth. We deliver billions of ad impressions and millions of clicks and break fresh ground in product and technical innovations every day!

As a Senior Applied Scientist on this team, you will:
Be the technical leader in Machine Learning; lead efforts within this team and across other teams.
Perform hands-on analysis and modeling of enormous data sets to develop insights that increase traffic monetization and merchandise sales, without compromising the shopper experience.
Drive end-to-end Machine Learning projects that have a high degree of ambiguity, scale, complexity.
Build machine learning models, perform proof-of-concept, experiment, optimize, and deploy your models into production; work closely with software engineers to assist in productionizing your ML models.
Run A/B experiments, gather data, and perform statistical analysis.
Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large-scale data analysis, machine-learning model development, model validation and serving.
Research new and innovative machine learning approaches.
Recruit Applied Scientists to the team and provide mentorship.

Why you will love this opportunity: Amazon is investing heavily in building a world-class advertising business. This team defines and delivers a collection of advertising products that drive discovery and sales. Our solutions generate billions in revenue and drive long-term growth for Amazon’s Retail and Marketplace businesses. We deliver billions of ad impressions, millions of clicks daily, and break fresh ground to create world-class products. We are a highly motivated, collaborative, and fun-loving team with an entrepreneurial spirit - with a broad mandate to experiment and innovate.

Impact and Career Growth: You will invent new experiences and influence customer-facing shopping experiences to help suppliers grow their retail business and the auction dynamics that leverage native advertising; this is your opportunity to work within the fastest-growing businesses across all of Amazon! Define a long-term science vision for our advertising business, driven from our customers' needs, translating that direction into specific plans for research and applied scientists, as well as engineering and product teams. This role combines science leadership, organizational ability, technical strength, product focus, and business understanding.

Summary
Seeking to hire an entry-level biostatistician/statistician to join the behavioral and physical activity research group in the Biostatistics and Data Research unit, Children’s Nutrition Research Center (CNRC). A large part of this role will be working in predictive and/or machine learning statistics.

This is an onsite role.
Job Duties
Performs duties under the guidance and supervision of a senior biostatistician
Assists senior biostatisticians in performing mathematical statistical work covering a variety of statistical methods, background research, and analysis
Apply basic data analytical techniques including descriptive summaries, data visualization, and basic modeling approaches, including but not limited to t-test, ANOVA, their non-parametric analogues, chi-square, correlation, and regression
Implements data management tasks and study documentation procedures
Assists faculty conducting background research and methods development
Assists with interpretation of results including significant factors, relationships, and trends
Writes technical reports on findings of statistical investigations
Assists with dissemination of mathematical or statistical concepts to non-statistical audience

Technical Requirements:
Stay current with knowledge related to the analytical methods needed to analyze different types of data formats and structures
Stay current with statistical programing and ability to use different software to address the increasing complexity of health-related data
Utilize quantitative and qualitative data to discover, validate, and enhance the Biostatistics and Data Research unit to benefit the CNRC research and methods development portfolio
Participates in research and evaluation studies to develop methodology by refining current methods, integrating different methods, or creating novel methods
Apply measurement and analytical best practices to solve real world statistical challenges
Conduct literature reviews pertinent to study design or statistical concepts
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Statistics, MIS, or related field.
Two years of relevant experience.
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in one of the following fields: Math, Statistics, Data Science, Experimental Design, Economics, or related field with 2+ years of applied experience or a Master degree with 1+ years of applied experience in one or more of these fields
Fluent with data and data structures from various sources; able to conduct quality control, query, analyze, and report results to answer relevant research questions
Strong communication skills
Working knowledge in predictive and/or machine learning statistics including, but not limited to multi-level regression, semi-parametric models, latent variable modeling, and multivariate analysis
Comfortable with joining interdisciplinary project teams and provide technical support

Job summary
Amazon Advertising sits at the intersection of e-commerce and advertising, developing new native advertising experiences that are a critical area of strategic focus for the company. The specific project details are confidential. We are seeking a Principal Applied Scientist to create and deliver ML innovation aimed at evolving Amazon's Advertising solutions, inventing new shopper and advertiser experiences, and accelerating the pace of Machine Learning innovation and optimization. From influencing customer facing shopping experiences to helping suppliers grow their retail business and the auction dynamics that leverage native advertising, this role will drive one the fastest growing businesses in Amazon.

This team develops algorithms and systems that improve the performance and delivery of Amazon's Display Advertising campaigns and automates campaign management using machine learning techniques. The team develops and deploying algorithms that drive ad selection, bidding, user response prediction, and automated campaign management. Data Scientist/Meteorologist
$120,000 - $160,000
HAPS operations are at the mercy of the winds. The position of meteorologist is the tip of the spear for both operational support and mission planning. While on the front lines, the incumbent meteorologist uses their encompassing knowledge of atmospheric dynamics and meteorological processes to establish global stratospheric climatological trends while simultaneously providing highly accurate boundary layer wind forecasts. In the HAPS business, an expansive understanding of boundary layer processes is a must as launch operations depend on a well-timed and accurate forecast but making it off the ground is only half of the battle. The incumbent meteorologist must also have a solid footing in data science in order to provide an accurate model of possible trajectory outcomes for all stages of mission operations.
What You Will Do
Provide accurate and timely weather forecasts for launch operations.
Provide HAPS trajectory analyses for mission planning.
Perform climatological characterizations of launch location viability around the globe.
Establish seasonality of the global stratospheric wind field as it pertains to Sceye HAPS operations.
As meteorology subject matter expert, provide weather products and support to the executive team and other sections as required.
Assist the software development team in creation and improvement of trajectory and data visualization software.
What You Need
Demonstrated knowledge of boundary layer dynamics, including diurnal micro-climates in mountainous terrain.
Demonstrated knowledge of stratospheric dynamics and the role of teleconnections such as ENSO.
Demonstrated understanding of Numerical Weather Prediction processes and limitations.
Surgically precise attention to detail.
Demonstrated proficiency in at least one programming language (python, JavaScript, C++, etc.).
Capability to successfully program and execute scripts for data processing.
Ability to provide high quality weather support while working in a high stress and fast paced environment.
Ability to provide weather briefings to groups of various sizes and levels of understanding.
Proven ability to self-start projects and stay on task in a dynamic team-oriented environment.
Experience and Education
Meteorology degree (greater than or equal to B.S.)
At least 6 years of operational weather forecasting experience
Where you Will Work
Sceye is based at a state-of-the-art facility at the airport in Moriarty, NM – an easy commute from Albuquerque, Santa Fe, and the small mountain towns of the Sandia Range. Office perks include a workout area, shower facilities, pickleball court, outdoor dog kennel, and a break area with complimentary snacks and beverages. Company lunches are provided daily by our executive chef.

As the Senior Data Analyst for Center for International Bone Marrow Transplant Research (CIBMTR) you will perform data analysis for transplant and cellular therapy patients in accordance to regulatory and registry reporting requirements. You will be responsible for data quality, accuracy, and timely entries into databases.
You will submit accurate data to CIBMTR.
You will ensure timely tracking and enrollment of stem cell transplant patients into federally mandated reporting systems.
You will oversee and ensure accurate data submission to CIBMTR.
You will delegate to data analyst I and II to ensure timely completion of data
You will participate in FACT accreditation by providing required documentation of the stem cell transplant patient.
You will comply with all policies, procedures, and regulatory standards.
You will generate reports from both STAFA and CIBMTR.
You will perform timely and accurate collection of all stem cell transplant information and follow-up information from the patient medical record and the patient’s providers.
You will oversee the Request for Information (RFI) process for all programs.
You will accurately complete of Comprehensive Report Forms (CRF), TED (Transplant Essential Data) and CTED (Cellular Therapeutic Essential Data) forms.
You will provide physicians and committees with updates on data information.
You will facilitate requests for information on stem cell transplant patients from third party payers as well as independent requests for information related to hospital participation in research trials.
You will provide all patient follow up and statistics as request by the stem cell transplant program.
You will incorporates cost-effectiveness into daily practice.
You will oversee and participate in internal and external data audits, as specified by the data analytics manager
You will prepare for and serve as the lead data analyst for all CIBMTR required data audits
You will interpret results of data audits and develops corrective action plan, as necessary
You will ensures all corrective action plans are completed and routinely audits for compliance
You should have for this position:
7+ years data analyst experience
Understand how to enter data inro the various required databases.
Vocational/Technical School in healthcare or research field
A Bachelor Degree is preferred
Society of Clinical Research Associates (SOCRA) or other related certification is preferred
Sarah Cannon is the Cancer Institute of HCA Healthcare. We offer integrated cancer services with easy access to cutting-edge therapies for communities across the United States and United Kingdom. Sarah Cannon’s cancer programs include individualized patient navigation. Our nurses are oncology-trained. Through its services, Sarah Cannon provides state-of-the-art cancer care for hundreds of thousands of patients. Our cancer experts are collaborating and sharing best practices. We address every aspect of the cancer journey, from screening and diagnosis through treatment and survivorship.
HCA Healthcare has been recognized as one of the World’s Most Ethical Companies® by the Ethisphere Institute more than ten times. In recent years, HCA Healthcare spent an estimated $3.7 billion in cost for the delivery of charitable care, uninsured discounts, and other uncompensated expenses.

Overview:
DATA SCIENTIST
(HYBRID – BOSTON; NEW YORK; WASHINGTON, D.C.; CHICAGO, SAN FRANCISCO, SILICON VALLEY, LOS ANGELES)

ABOUT CORNERSTONE RESEARCH

We are one of the premier economic consulting firms in the US and Europe. We provide economic and financial expertise to attorneys, corporations, and government agencies involved in complex litigation. These litigation matters may span a wide variety of topics including securities, mergers, antitrust, fraud, or discrimination. We consistently work on the most prominent cases involving Fortune 500 companies and government agencies (e.g. SEC, DOJ, ECB, etc.) in the United States and European Union.

We work collaboratively with academics and experts in economics, data science, machine learning, statistics, finance, marketing, accounting, and healthcare. Our collaborative teams span eight offices and total over 700 full-time employees.

ABOUT THE TEAM

The Data Science Center at Cornerstone Research is a tight knit but growing group of Data Scientists and Data Engineers. We are tasked with streamlining and innovating all data work at Cornerstone Research. Collectively, we build and maintain databases and infrastructure, data pipelines, ML and NLP models, data viz, and internal packages in Python/R. We also automate redundant processes, set standards for all code and Git across the firm, and act as internal consultants for all things data. Our ultimate goal is to use the best software, models and practices to deliver high-quality analysis in the cleanest, streamlined, and accurate manner possible. Some examples of the work the team has done to answer specific questions in the past include:
Fine-tuning the Detectron2 ML model to identify specific products inside of hundreds ofthousands of images found across social media – were influencers promoting the use of adangerous product?
Creating novel geospatial data visualizations of industry concentrations in particular regions ofthe United States – were there opportunities for monopolistic behavior among merging firms?
Developing API pipelines from dozens of public and private sources to collect economic, financial,legal, and healthcare data – how can our team automate relevant data collection so we can focusmore of our time on meaningful modeling and analysis?
Building semi-supervised NLP models to categorize free-form text found among millions ofTwitter posts – were adult brands targeting minors in a harmful way?

POSITION SUMMARY

Data Scientists at Cornerstone are generalists (https://e2eml.school/data_science_archetypes.html). Some of us have stronger skills in text mining and NLP, others in DevOps or geospatial analysis. But all of us have proficiency across data engineering/ETLs, data manipulation, data analysis, and machine learning. These shared skills are used to deliver high quality data products to our experts and consulting teams to cut through data complexities and clarify the most reissues underlying major litigation disputes or investigations. The vast majority of our technical work is done in SQL, R, Python, and AWS. Our team occasionally uses other languages like SAS, STATA, MATLAB, and C++ if client needs for these languages arise.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Hard skills
Ingest, explore, clean, build, sample, and prepare data from clients and public sources
Engineer data pipelines and execute ETL flows from large client data transfers and web APIs
Develop econometric, statistical, and ML models to predict and analyze data
Build packages to automate repetitive workflows through reusable code
Work with structured and unstructured data (e.g. financial records, free form text, JSON,images, geospatial telemetry, social media posts, retail transactions, clinical trials, etc.)
Use and expand scripts/packages for text mining, ML, data visualization, geospatial analysis,web data collection, social media analytics, and advanced statistics and simulations.

Soft Skills
Respond efficiently and effectively to varying client needs, often with little lead time
Communicate clearly with and work closely alongside other team members and consultantsAct as technical lead for groups of analysts in all data and coding work for case teams
Mentor more junior analysts in coding and Git best practices
Proactively seek out opportunities to automate or package up programmatic solutions torepetitive problems
Work with autonomy and independence while managing time appropriately

QUALIFICATIONS

Hard Skills
MA/MS, preferably in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or related field, or equivalent experience.
3+ years professional experience solving complex quantitative problems on large datasets with SQL and Python/R.
Strong proficiency in all of the following: Python, R, SQL, Git, Linux/Unix/Bash/Shell
Experience applying machine learning and NLP models and algorithms to real world data.

Soft Skills
Client Service: Effectively anticipate, monitor, and meet the needs of internal and externalclients by delivering a high-quality product. Ability to solve both clear and ambiguousproblems with moderate guidance.
Business Acumen: Understand Cornerstone’s financial and operational functions. Alignservices and performance of self and team with Cornerstone’s strategic goals.
Communication: Communicate effectively and professionally with colleagues, clients andvendors.
Leadership: Demonstrate a strong commitment to Cornerstone’s values and strategicgoals. Serve as a role model and promote a positive work environment. Demonstratedinterest and aptitude for mentoring and teaching programming skills.

Nice to Haves (any are a plus!)
Experience building software and cloud infrastructure using principles of CI/CD
Experience using AWS for data storage, analysis, and visualization (S3, Redshift, EC2, etc.)
Experience with Spark (or other parallel processing tools like Netezza, Teradata, Greenplum, Aster Data, or Vertica).
Experience developing and testing packages in Python and R.
Familiarity with C, C++, C#, Ruby, Java, and/or JavaScript.
Familiarity with SAS, STATA, MATLAB, Octave, or Julia.

Equal Employment Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or other factors protected by law.

To Apply
To apply, please email your resume and a cover letter expressing your interest to Julia Zhang (JZhang@cornerstone.com)

The CCB Business Modeling Center of Excellence consists of an intellectually diverse team of economists, statisticians, engineers, and other analytics professionals, focused on applied AI and quantitative modeling within CCB at JPMorgan Chase & Co. The team answers complex and unique questions, utilizing cutting edge quantitative and computational techniques and leverage one of the world's largest repositories of consumer data. We partner with teams across JPMC to assess and execute critical business decisions and engage in work in a variety of business domains that leverage knowledge in at least one of the following areas:
Time-Series (e.g. Seasonal Decomposition, ARIMAX, Vector Autoregression

Develop presentations to summarize and communicate key messages to senior management, sponsors and colleagues.

Actively contribute to the continuous learning mindset of the organization by bringing in new ideas and perspectives that stretch the thinking of the group.

Experience in developing machine learning, optimization, and/or statistical models to solve real world problems (e.g. Classification, Regression, Recommender Systems, Natural Language Processing, or Neural Language Modeling).

Strong analytical, interpretive, and problem-solving skills, with demonstrated ability of thinking outside the box.
2+ years of related experience preferred.

Model development experience on a cloud development platform.

Job summary
Amazon Advertising is one of Amazon's fastest growing and most profitable businesses. As a core product offering within our advertising portfolio, Sponsored Products (SP) helps merchants, retail vendors, and brand owners succeed via native advertising, which grows incremental sales of their products sold through Amazon. The SP team's primary goals are to help shoppers discover new products they love, be the most efficient way for advertisers to meet their business objectives, and build a sustainable business that continuously innovates on behalf of customers. Our products and solutions are strategically important to enable our Retail and Marketplace businesses to drive long-term growth. We deliver billions of ad impressions and millions of clicks and break fresh ground in product and technical innovations every day!

We are looking for a Data Scientist for the Sponsored Products Signal Innovation team. Sponsored Products helps merchants, retail vendors, and brand owners succeed via native advertising that grows incremental sales of their products sold through Amazon. The Sponsored Products Signal Innovation team works on identifying key data quality improvement opportunities and solving complex engineering, optimization, econometric, and data science problems to deliver relevant product ads on Amazon search pages world-wide. Using a combination of big-data analytics, machine learning and experimentation, our scientists develop insights and optimizations that enable the monetization of Amazon online and mobile search properties while enhancing the experience of Amazon shoppers.

As a Data Scientist on this team you will:
Solve real world problems by analyzing large amounts of business data, diving deep to identify business insights and opportunities, designing simulations and experiments, developing statistical and ML models by tailoring to business needs, and collaborating with Scientists, Engineers, BIE's, and Product Managers.
Translate business questions and concerns into specific quantitative questions that can be answered with available data using sound methodologies. In cases where questions cannot be answered with available data, work with engineers to produce the required data.
Deliver with independence on challenging large scale problems with ambiguity.
Manage and drive the technical and analytical aspects of Advertiser segmentation; continually advance approach and methods.
Retrieve, synthesize, and present critical data in a format that is immediately useful to answering specific questions or improving system performance.
Analyze historical data to identify trends and support decision making.
Improve upon existing methodologies by developing new data sources, testing model enhancements, and fine-tuning model parameters.
Provide requirements to develop analytic capabilities, platforms, and pipelines.
Apply statistical or machine learning knowledge to specific business problems and data.
Formalize assumptions about how our systems are expected to work, create statistical definition of the outlier, and develop methods to systematically identify these outliers. Work out why such examples are outliers and define if any actions needed.
Given anecdotes about anomalies or generate automatic scripts to define anomalies, deep dive to explain why they happen, and identify fixes.
Build decision-making models and propose solution for the business problem you defined
Conduct written and verbal presentation to share insights and recommendations to audiences of varying levels of technical sophistication.
Utilize code (python or another object oriented language) for data analyzing and modeling algorithms.

Why you love this opportunity
Amazon is investing heavily in building a world-class advertising business. This team is responsible for defining and delivering a collection of advertising products that drive discovery and sales. Our solutions generate billions in revenue and drive long-term growth for Amazon’s Retail and Marketplace businesses. We deliver billions of ad impressions, millions of clicks daily, and break fresh ground to create world-class products. We are highly motivated, collaborative, and fun-loving team with an entrepreneurial spirit - with a broad mandate to experiment and innovate.

Impact and Career Growth
You will invent new experiences and influence customer-facing shopping experiences to help suppliers grow their retail business and the auction dynamics that leverage native advertising; this is your opportunity to work within the fastest-growing businesses across all of Amazon! Define a long-term science vision for our advertising business, driven fundamentally from our customers' needs, translating that direction into specific plans for research and applied scientists, as well as engineering and product teams. This role combines science leadership, organizational ability, technical strength, product focus, and business understanding.

Team video https://youtu.be/zD_6Lzw8raE

Advanced degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or related quantitative field.
Broad knowledge of ML methods, statistical analysis, and problem-solving skills.
Expert level knowledge in statistics and sophisticated user of statistical tools.
Experience in data applications using large scale distributed systems (e.g. EMR, Spark, Elasticsearch, Hadoop, Pig, and Hive).
Experience processing, filtering, and presenting large data sets (hundreds of millions/billions of rows).
Combination of deep technical skills and business sense, to interface with all levels and disciplines within our customer’s organization.
Demonstrable track record of dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in a dynamic environment.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to advocate technical solutions for science, engineering, and business audiences.
Ability to develop experimental and analytical plans for data modeling, use effective baselines, and accurately determine cause-and-effect relations.
Experience in computational advertising is a plus.

Overview:
Data Scientist – Credit Risk Analytics
Location: Remote or Hybrid Opportunity in Chesterbrook, PA

The Credit Risk Analytics team at J.G Wentworth develops superior predictive insights into consumer behavior in order to provide consumers the right solutions for their financial needs while providing investors excellent risk adjusted returns. The team maintains credit risk models, underwriting and pricing strategies for the consumer lending businesses. The team uses credit bureau data, as well as various alternative data assets and customer data to perform in-depth analyses, optimize acquisition strategies, credit decisioning and portfolio outcomes.

We are looking for highly motivated, innovative individuals with high intellectual curiosity, strong technical and problem-solving skills who want to make an immediate impact in helping consumers meet their financial needs.
Responsibilities:
Key Responsibilities:
Perform complex analyses using a variety of analytical techniques and data sources to ensure profitability, safety and soundness of the consumer lending products
Develop and implement processes for data extraction, data cleaning and transformation, and data validation for credit analytics and modeling
Develop and test hypotheses using complex analyses to generate key risk and consumer insights
Query and analyze multiple large data sets, including credit bureau data and other alternative data sets to optimize credit policy, customer acquisition and pricing decisions
Assess new data sources in support of credit management strategies
Support/lead model development using relevant ML algorithms and programming languages
Develop analytical reports and presentations for senior management, internal and external stakeholders
Collaborate effectively within the Credit Analytics Team as well across functions of the firm
Qualifications:
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering)
2-4 years of experience in a similar analytic role in consumer lending with a bank or fintech
Minimum 2 years of experience using SQL as well as open-source programming languages such as Python or R in analyzing large data sets
Hands-on experience with credit bureau data and credit analysis
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills
Demonstrated ability to communicate ideas and analysis results effectively both verbally and in writing to both a technical and non-technical audience.
Advanced Microsoft Office skills, specifically Excel
Basic PowerBI and Tableau experience
Attention to detail and ability to prioritize tasks, experience with agile methodology a plus
Ability to meet tight deadlines, multitask, flexibility, and setting priorities
Ability to work in both a team environment and independently
Preferred:
Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline (Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, etc.)
Experience developing predictive models using R, Python or similar language and common ML frameworks
Experience developing credit attributes from credit bureau data and customer data
Familiarity with consumer-permissioned bank transaction data
Experience in data visualization and reporting solutions such as PowerBI and Tableau

Description

Who are we, and what do we do?
At Corteva Agriscience, you will help us grow what’s next. No matter your role, you will be part of a team that is building the future of agriculture – leading breakthroughs in the innovation and application of science and technology that will better the lives of people all over the world and fuel the progress of humankind.
Corteva Agriscience™ has an exciting opportunity for a Senior Data Scientist with expertise in statistical and machine learning methods. The successful candidate will join a robust, diverse, and globally distributed Data Science team that develops and applies innovative methods and tools to deliver insights for R&D. The candidate will partner with leading industrial scientists to support our growing data science efforts in Crop Protection discovery and Development. The Senior Data Scientist will lead projects applying and researching data science methods, along with providing technical mentorship for junior data scientists. The position will be based in Indianapolis, IN to allow for strong collaboration with laboratory chemists, but remote work needs of highly qualified candidates will be considered.
Responsibilities:
How will you help us grow? It matters to us, and it matters to you!
Lead projects to apply machine learning/statistical modeling and interpret complex datasets to enable data-driven decisions
Provide data science expertise and collaborate with scientists to achieve robust solutions to important business challenges
Develop and deploy end-to-end data analysis pipelines and applications for users with diverse backgrounds in chemical and biological disciplines
Communicate results in internal and external forums and contribute to scientific articles
Provide technical leadership, mentoring, and critique to junior data scientists
Qualifications

Requirements:
What expertise have you grown? What do you bring to the table?
Educational Qualifications
Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, Operations Research, Statistics, Computational Chemistry, or related highly quantitative fields with 3+ years of relevant experience, or comparable combinations of formal education and relevant experience.
Required Qualifications
Proven ability to independently translate scientific needs into Data Science problems by asking the right questions and deliver solutions by identifying necessary data, building models, and producing actionable results.
Practical experience with supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms (e.g. decision trees, neural networks, SVM, clustering)
Understanding of the fundamental statistical and mathematical bases of machine learning algorithms
Experience with feature selection, model diagnostics, remedial measures, and validation
Strong expertise in data wrangling/munging
Ability to master concepts from new application domains
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to successfully lead projects and collaborate with colleagues from diverse technical backgrounds
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills, flexibility, and willingness to learn
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in the application of statistical experimental design (e.g., randomized complete/incomplete block designs, central composite designs)
Experience conducting statistical analyses of designed and observational experiments
Expertise in complex neural network methods
Experience consulting on scientific projects or working within a scientific team
Experience or education in chemistry/biochemistry
Community:
We care about you and we care that you're comfortable. While there's no place like home, Corteva comes close.

Enjoy access to health benefits for you and your family on your first day of employment
And much, much more!

Job Overview
As a Senior Data Scientist, you are responsible for leading the application of machine learning techniques and statistical methods to solve business problems. You will collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team of technical and non-technical business stakeholders on a wide range of challenges. You must demonstrate expertise across the entire machine learning (ML) lifecycle, including problem framing, data collection, exploratory data analysis, model development, deployment, and performance measurement. Paramount to this job is the understanding that a Senior Data Scientist represents technical expertise and leadership within the Data Science team in creating real business value from data.
Job Responsibilities:
Extract, prepare and model large, complex data sets using a combination of skills, including machine learning theory, mathematics, statistics, and programming.
Deliver on-time quality analysis, interpretation, and synthesis of data into effective, concise, and actionable recommendations that enable intelligent decisioning for the company.
Provide senior-level guidance and mentorship to the data science team, including reviewing projects, models, and code for peers and junior team members.
Work with engineering teams to implement and improve machine learning pipelines and production-ready models.
Effectively communicate important information and insights to business leaders using verbal, written, and data visualization skills.
Education:
Bachelor's Degree Quantitative Discipline (math, statistics, economics, computer science, physics, engineering, etc.) (Required)
Master's/Advanced Degree Quantitative Discipline (math, statistics, economics, computer science, physics, engineering) (Preferred)
Work Experience:

4-7 years Experience with data scripting languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R) ()
2-4 years Experience with big data architecture and pipeline, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Kafka, etc. ()
4-7 years Experience articulating and translating business questions and using statistical techniques to arrive at an answer using available data ()
4-7 years Experience in data visualization ()
4-7 years Experience working with relational database using SQL ()
2-4 years Experience in the telecom industry ()
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Mathematics Calculus, linear algebra, statistics, and probability ()
Programming Expertise in Python and SQL ()
Machine Learning: Expertise applying machine learning concepts and techniques related to supervised and unsupervised learning ()
Communication Strong communication skills, ability to work with cross functional teams ()

At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States

Company Description

Zurn Elkay Water Solutions Corporation is a thriving, values-driven company focused on doing the right things. We’re a fast growing, publicly traded company (NYSE: ZWS), with an enduring reputation for integrity, giving back, and providing an engaging, inclusive environment where careers flourish and grow.
Named by Newsweek as One of America’s Most Responsible Companies and an Energage USA Top Workplace, at Zurn Elkay Water Solutions Corporation, we never forget that our people are at the center of what makes us successful. They are the driving force behind our superior quality, product ingenuity, and exceptional customer experience. Our commitment to our people and their professional development is a recipe for success that has fueled our growth for over 100 years, as one of today’s leading international suppliers of plumbing and water delivery solutions.
Headquartered in Milwaukee, WI, Zurn Elkay Water Solutions Corporation employs over 2800 employees worldwide, working from 24 locations across the U.S., China, Canada, Dubai, and Mexico, with sales offices available around the globe. We hope you’ll visit our website and learn more about Zurn Elkay at www.zurn-elkay.com.
If you’re ready to join a company where what you do makes a difference and you have pride in the work you are doing, talk to us about joining the Zurn Elkay Water Solutions Corporation family!

Job Description

As a Data Scientist within the Commercial Sales team, you will leverage a robust and modern analytics infrastructure and diverse data assets to provide actionable insights across sales, marketing, pricing, manufacturing, logistics, supply chain, and finance. In this role, you will be called upon to deploy advanced analytic techniques and technical skills to build machine learning and A/I tools that will deliver proactive solutions that enable a successful sales culture. We are looking for someone who is passionate about data science, predictive analytics, and machine learning technologies including but not limited to data exploration, sampling, training data generation, model building, and performance evaluation. In this role, you will apply analytical rigor, critical thinking, and creativity to solve complex business issues while working with teams from across the organization.
Key Accountabilities
Establish partnerships with key business functions to identify potential opportunity areas, form hypotheses, and drive strategic insight generation.
Build the Data Science capability within the Commercial Sales organization by defining processes, discovering and implementing tools and techniques, and building trust through successful execution.
Leverage and apply sound modeling techniques to produce meaningful business insights that can be applied across Commercial Sales and Marketing.
Provide consultation to business areas on key insights generated and on the development of action plans.
Effectively translate and communicate actionable insights and capabilities to all levels of the organization that drive business decisions and strategies, ensuring analytics are understood and leveraged

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics or Business. Master’s degree preferred
5+ years of hands-on data science expertise including, but not limited to, machine learning, statistics, and data visualization
Strong understanding and experience with analytics tool such as Tableau and OBIEE/OAC (or similar tools) for reporting and visualization, Snowflake for data storage, data modeling, data prep or ETL tools, R or Python, SQL, and data catalogs.
Strong understanding and experience with multiple statistical and quantitative models and techniques such as (but not limited to) Regression, Classification, Clustering, Neural Network, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, SVM, graph analysis, computer vision etc.
Experience applying data science to solve problems in at least one of the following areas is required. Experience in multiple areas is preferred: marketing, manufacturing, pricing, logistics, sourcing, and sales.
Self-starter who can handle time-sensitive tasks with accuracy and efficiency
Experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 (D365) ERM and Microsoft Dynamics CRM a plus
Strong Analytical and critical thinking to solve business problems
Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment
Capabilities and Success Factors
Decision Quality – Making good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward.
Manages Complexity – Making sense of complex, high quantity and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems.
Plans & Aligns – Planning and prioritizing work to meet commitments aligned with organizational goals.
Drives Results – Consistently achieving results, even under tough circumstances.
Collaborates – Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.

Additional Information

Competitive Salary

Matching 401(k) Contribution
Health Savings Account
Educational Reimbursement
Matching Gift Program
