What happens when two remarkable sustainability leaders come together as one?
A sustainability powerhouse is born, making a splash in the markets they serve and saving the planet one innovative installation at a time.
In early 2022, Zurn Water Solutions Corporation, a market leader in smart, sustainable water solutions, and Elkay Manufacturing, a commercial drinking water solutions leader, agreed to combine their two exceptional firms to become a single water solutions powerhouse.
Together, the combined company offers a comprehensive package of innovative, sustainable, specified, engineered water solutions and sustainable plumbing products that provide water safety, water quality, and water conservation through critical service environments, while delivering total building solutions for new construction and retrofit applications around the globe. Our innovative solutions enable customers to advance their ESG initiatives and reduce operating costs while providing students, patients, patrons, and people within public and private spaces a safe, clean environment and access to fresh, pure, potable water – the essence of life itself.
What makes Zurn Elkay Water Solutions Corporation special is our people and our culture.
While playing a leading role in sustainability and water access are remarkable, what makes Zurn Elkay’s story so compelling is the alignment of the two well-respected companies with powerful legacies and a combined 224-year company history and shared values and cultures where people matter most.
Sustainably inspired, the company has a deep commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion, water, and environmental stewardship, and giving back to the communities where we live, work and play. Our powerful legacy of caring and commitment is made possible by the exceptional people that embody Zurn Elkay’s values.
We’re looking for innovative, energetic people who want to help solve tomorrow’s challenges today. Our Total Associate Engagement core value means we work hard to ensure our associates have opportunities to grow and an inclusive culture in which to thrive. From formal training to on-the-job development and exposure to new businesses, when you join Zurn Elkay, you’ll join a collaborative organization that will give you opportunities to thrive and grow.

Overview
We have an exciting opportunity that is defining how we use analytics to transform customer experiences, accelerate business growth and optimize our growth efforts. We are looking for a data-driven individual with excellent analytical skills; someone who is an independent self-starter with experience in product conversion, engagement, and retention, and possesses a passion for delivering data-driven insights to join Intuit’s Analytics Center of Excellence.
What you'll bring
3+ years of experience working with product analytics, web analytics, customer care analytics, or other customer experience analytics
Highly proficient in SQL, A/B Testing, Tableau, and Excel. Familiarity with Product Analytics Tools (Amplitude, Mixpanel, Segment, etc.)
Experience in programming languages and stats packages (e.g., Python, R); experience in developing and deploying machine learning models preferred
Experience in driving end to end measurement frameworks
Ability to tell stories with data, educate effectively, and instill confidence, motivating stakeholders to act on recommendations
Ability to influence business decisions and utilizing data at the leadership level
Strategic thinker with ability to provide solutions for business problems
Excellent problem-solving skills and end-to-end quantitative thinking
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously to meet objectives and key deadlines
Outstanding communications skills with both technical and non-technical leaders and colleagues
Proactive and inquisitive learner seeks out and capitalizes on opportunities for change that solve for our customers, rather than reacting to circumstances
Strong organization, time management and task prioritization skills
Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Analytics, Finance, Advanced Analytics, or related field. Master’s Degree preferred
How you will lead
Driving business strategy: You will provide recommendations utilizing multiple types of data, business knowledge, and strategic assumptions when data doesn’t exist. You will be critical to decision-making
Identifying opportunities and influencing partners to act: You will partner with Product and Customer Support leaders to provide key customer insights and influence strategic decisions. You will collaborate with stakeholders and analysts to ensure reporting solutions are scalable, repeatable, effective, and meet expectations of various leaders
Driving self-serve and data literacy: You will define, implement and standardize metrics, reports and dashboards. You will pursue data quality, troubleshoot data validation, and see issues to resolution. In addition, you will collaborate with Data Engineering in building innovative data capture and real-time analytic capabilities needed by the business

Job Description:

About COE
Have you ever dreamed of going to a job that you love? Well, you need to look no further - COE is an award-winning workplace with a balanced focus on client, employee, and company. We offer competitive benefits and a flexible environment focused on your success. We encourage all interested candidates to apply! It’s time to see if COE is the right place for the next step in your career - we are ready to invest in you!
As an EEO employer, COE celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment of equitability where equal opportunities are available to all applicants and COE employees. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

About the Role

COE is seeking Data Analysts to help a major federal healthcare agency develop new data capacities.

The ideal candidate is very passionate about helping clients be user-centric, use data to make decisions, and ensure their organization is effective, and efficient. Data will be for internal and public facing use and be used to report to Congress and other senior stakeholders such as agency leadership and medical practitioners. This position will be in a hybrid work environment within the D.C metropolitan area.

Join us for an exciting opportunity with a leading retail organization with a wide range of customer interactions and analytics. Interaction with the business stakeholders will provide an opportunity for creative problem solving and model development. Continuous learning and improvement for both the business subject matter expertise and emerging algorithms and techniques will be a constant development going forward.

Job Description

Develops and/or uses algorithms and statistical predictive models and determines analytical approaches and modeling techniques to evaluate scenarios and potential future outcomes
Performs analyses of structured and unstructured data to solve multiple and/or complex business problems utilizing advanced statistical techniques and mathematical analyses and broad knowledge of the organization and/or industry
Collaborates with business partners to understand their problems and goals, develop predictive modeling, statistical analysis, data reports and performance metrics
Develops and participates in presentations and consultations to existing and prospective constituents on analytics results and solutions
Interacts with internal and external peers and managers to exchange complex information related to areas of specialization
Use strong knowledge in algorithms and predictive models to investigate problems, detect patterns and recommend solutions

Machine Learning model development
experience

Amazon is investing heavily in building a world class advertising business, operating at the intersection of retail and advertising. Amazon Advertising delivers billions of ad impressions and millions of clicks daily and is breaking fresh ground to create unique advertising experiences for hundreds of thousands of advertisers and shoppers globally. Our team, Physical Stores Advertising, focuses on developing engaging advertising products for customers that shop at physical stores, such as Whole Foods Market, Amazon Fresh, Amazon Style, and Amazon Go, as well as third-party stores not owned by Amazon. We're tackling a relatively new area for Amazon Advertising and building technology from the ground up. This is a great opportunity to get in on the ground floor on a high-growth team that values experimentation and innovation. We start with the customer and work backwards in everything we do. If you are interested in joining a rapidly growing team working to build a unique, world-class advertising group with a relentless focus on the customer, you have come to the right place.

Our Team:
We own building, launching, and commercializing innovative ad products in-store and do not shy away from technical challenges. Our team is responsible for full-stack implementation and integration of new advertising products, which power the ad content, targeting, and attribution across our advertising network with physical stores. We utilize the latest in cloud technology to build out products supporting custom experiences, both in browser and on mobile platforms, using custom hardware and android operating systems. We are also experimenting in new areas, leveraging computer vision, machine learning, and big data, to provide unique experiences for physical store shoppers and advertisers alike.
What We Are Looking For:
We are looking for exceptionally motivated and talented Data Engineers who are self-starters with strong customer obsession to transform advertising in physical stores. The ideal candidate will have excellent problem investigation abilities, and the ability to synthesize data into crisp and clear recommendations for scientists and product leaders. To be successful in this role, you should have broad skills in database design, be comfortable dealing with large and complex data sets, have experience building self-service dashboards, be comfortable using visualization tools, and be able to apply your skills to generate insights that help solve business needs.

What To Expect:
Engineers and Scientists who join our team will find the work has a high-growth potential with a large scope and complexity which can be catered to your professional development goals. You will have the opportunity to learn and become an expert in multiple domains technical and functional. We have a tenured leadership team with years of experience in their respective fields and we strive to be Earth’s best employer. For us, this means we care about work life balance, host team events and happy hours, hold hackathons to foster innovation, prioritize building a diverse culture, care about individual success, and never take ourselves too seriously.

The Miami Institute for Data Science and Computing (IDSC) has an exciting job opportunity for a Director of Data Science Partnerships to work at the Coral Gables Campus.
CORE JOB SUMMARY
The Director of Data Science Partnerships is responsible for seeking research engagement opportunities between IDSC faculty, complementary faculty, researchers, and industry to meet the objective of expanding the use of data science. The Director serves as a liaison to community leaders, external organizations, and stakeholders significant to the Institute for Data Science's strategic plans and initiates and manages programs that support the director’s vision for the Institute. The Director facilitates partnerships with universities, the corporate sector, NGOs, governments, international organizations including the Caribbean and Latin America and the like, in support of the Institute for Data Science and Computing’s basic and applied research initiatives.
CORE JOB FUNCTIONS
Serves as an industry liaison and relationship manager in support of IDSC initiatives. This includes development of strategies to promote initiatives, writing proposals, chairing or staffing committees, and consultation with administrators or appropriate staff.
Develops and advises on strategies to broaden IDSC engagement with faculty across all Schools and Colleges at UM.
Cultivates, manages, and grows relationships with industry partners.
Leads inbound and outbound business development efforts.
Leads special collaborations with select industry partners.
Initiates innovative ideas that add value to industry partnerships
Develops compelling presentations and proposals.
Organizes industry meetings with relevant internal and external stakeholders.
Scouts technologies and research programs to be presented as potential research projects with industry.
Organizes matters relating to managed collaborations including scheduling and managing committee meetings within the Institute.
Ensures compliance with all aspects of the industry partner agreements.
Collaborates with IDSC’s business office to tracks administrative matters relating to industry projects and research programs, once launched.
Works with internal IDSC teams to develop visibility / communications activities to promote industry partnership(s) and research programs.
Collaborates with IDSC’s innovation officer to explore new market opportunities for startups and technology firms via partnerships that support pilots and proof of concept projects.
As needed, facilitates intellectual property and technology transfer efforts with the Office of Technology Transfer.
Identifies companies with potential interest in data science research projects.
Identifies strategic opportunities and coordinates the participation of senior IDSC officials at key community forums and events in order to advance the Institute’s mission.
Maintains records of industry engagement in customer relational database and proactively markets faculty research to appropriate contacts.
Participates in outside professional activities to maintain knowledge on developments in the field.
Expand IDSC presence and visibility across Latin America.
This list of duties and responsibilities is not intended to be all-inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties or responsibilities as necessary.
CORE QUALIFICATIONS
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in relevant field, PhD Preferred.
Experience:
Minimum 7 years of relevant experience including experience in a leadership position within industry. Five (5) years of experience leading, managing and building industry/academic partnerships. Any appropriate combination of relevant education and/or work experience may be considered.
Knowledge, Skills and Attitudes:
Understanding and experience with developing and growing industry partnerships.
Ability to effectively interact with all levels of industry and University employees.
Highly organized, resourceful, and detail oriented.
Ability to lead and motivate others.
Ability to maintain effective interpersonal relationships.
Ability to make independent judgments and act on decisions on a daily basis.
Ability to work with flexibility on several tasks simultaneously and to meet various concurrent deadlines.
Flexibility to travel as needed to support IDSC Initiatives
Commitment to the University’s core values.

Position description
Data Scientists at Mayo Clinic perform detailed analysis of large bodies of heterogeneous data in order to discover new patterns and insights having an impact upon patient health and augmenting human capabilities. Candidate has advanced expertise in AI, machine learning, deep learning, statistical data processing, regression techniques, neural networks, decision trees, clustering, pattern recognition, probability theory and data science methods and the mathematical theories underlying these tools used to analyze data. Has advanced knowledge of healthcare data types, topics, and scientific challenges and approaches.
May work with knowledge architects, informaticians and clinicians at Mayo, and partner outside companies to develop and deploy applications to bring AI and analytic solutions to nontechnical users, often at the point of care. Applies and modifies existing scripts or software applications to support data management, data extraction, data analysis, and AI as required
May develop predictive models on large-scale datasets to address various business problems through leveraging advanced statistical modeling, operations research, machine learning, or data mining techniques. May provide Consultative Services at an enterprise level to departments/divisions and/or support scientific projects under the supervision of a designated senior level data scientist.

Other responsibilities:
Provides advanced data insights for complex business problems that can be approached with analytics techniques to collect, explore, and extract insights from structured and unstructured data.
Has advanced expertise in the methods used to analyze data and advanced knowledge of data types, topics, and scientific challenges and approaches.
Will work with other staff in developing data analysis tools and predictive models, using advanced data analysis techniques and artificial intelligence and machine learning.
Participates in discovery processes with stakeholders to identify the business requirements and the expected outcome.
Leads the interpretation of data analysis and writing reports.

Qualifications
A Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as engineering, mathematics, computer science, health science and at least 12 graduate level semester hours in domain-relevant sciences or seven years or more of data science and AI experience.
The preferred candidate will possess a PhD or Master’s degree with one year experience in a relevant field such as engineering, mathematics, computer science, health science, or other analytical/quantitative field and a minimum of one year of professional or research experience in data.

The successful candidate will need to have both technical and business background/experience along with strong leadership skills. Good written and oral communication skills are required. Expertise in the use of scientific computing and data management packages. Ability to prioritize, organize, and delegate various tasks on projects. Demonstrated initiative in administration, education (seminars, training), software development, and technical reports. Demonstrated success in project management and communication skills.

Additional qualifications
Demonstrated ability to develop predictive and prescriptive models on large-scale datasets to address various business problems through leveraging advanced statistical modeling, machine learning, or data mining techniques. Demonstrated ability to provide consultative services to departments/divisions and committees from any Mayo entity requesting assistance is preferred. Demonstrated application of several problem-solving methodologies, planning techniques, continuous improvement methods, project management methods, and analytical tools and methodologies (e.g. machine learning, statistical packages, modeling, etc.) required. Incumbent must have ability to manage a varied workload of projects with multiple priorities and stay current on healthcare trends and enterprise changes. Strong interpersonal skills to include presentation, negotiation, persuasion, and written communications skills are required. Strong time management skills also are required. In addition, requires strong analytical skills, consulting skills, ability to identify and recommend solutions, advanced computer application skills and a commitment to customer service. Experience with data modeling and date exploration tools.

Job Description
Data Scientist
Are you looking for a patient-focused, innovation-driven company that will inspire you and empower you to shine? Join us as a Data Scientist in our Lexington, MA location.
At Takeda, we are transforming the pharmaceutical industry through our R&D-driven market leadership and being a values-led company. To do this, we empower our people to realize their potential through life-changing work. Certified as a Global Top Employer, we offer stimulating careers, encourage innovation, and strive for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our global teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world.
Here, you will be a vital contributor to our inspiring, bold mission.
As a Data Scientist working on the Advanced Analytical Technologies team, you will be empowered to support and lead activities related to designing, building, and deploying industry-leading smart algorithms and predictive models from various analytical data including spectroscopy.
POSITION OBJECTIVES:
Work closely together with the automation and process analytical technology (PAT) teams
Learn, develop, plan and optimize data workstreams directly from laboratory sources
Work closely together with analytical experts in development and application of PAT technology
Plan and coordinate the setup of at-line analytics with Analytical Development team
Coordinate with other development teams to promote collaborative data management efforts, interoperability, and shared infrastructure
Knowledge sharing with global partners, internal and external
Present accomplishments within the team, across other functions, internally and externally – cooperation partners, conferences etc.
POSITION ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Collaboration with multiple multi-functional teams of scientists, analysts, and engineers.
Implement mechanistic and statistical modeling and simulation
Support development and implementation of digital twins
Define modeling and simulation work packages as standard for future development projects in an AQbD environment
Evaluate technology/software with internal and external partners
EDUCATION, BEHAVIORAL COMPETENCIES AND SKILLS:
Bachelors degree in Data Science, Statistics, Bio-Informatics, Mathematics, Chemometrics, Chemistry, Biology, Engineering or related pharmaceutical science and 4+ years relevant industry experience
Masters degree in Data Science, Statistics, Bio-Informatics, Mathematics, Chemometrics, Chemistry, Biology, Engineering or related pharmaceutical science 2+ years relevant industry experience
PhD in Data Science, Statistics, Bio-Informatics, Mathematics, Chemometrics, Chemistry, Biology, Engineering or related pharmaceutical science and 0+ years relevant industry experience
Background in DoE, continuous processing, automation and digitalization of bioprocesses
Experience with regression and classification modeling, data pre-processing, statistical concepts, and the ability to work in multiple languages (Python, R, Scala, C/C++, SQL).
Experience with various analytical software (JMP, SIMCA, Minitab)

Overview

Guidehouse is a leading global provider of consulting services to the public sector and commercial markets, with broad capabilities in management, technology, and risk consulting. By combining our public and private sector expertise, we help clients address their most complex challenges and navigate significant regulatory pressures focusing on transformational change, business resiliency, and technology-driven innovation. Across a range of advisory, consulting, outsourcing, and digital services, we create scalable, innovative solutions that help our clients outwit complexity and position them for future growth and success. The company has more than 12,000 professionals in over 50 locations globally. Guidehouse is a Veritas Capital portfolio company, led by seasoned professionals with proven and diverse expertise in traditional and emerging technologies, markets, and agenda-setting issues driving national and global economies. For more information, please visit www.guidehouse.com.


Responsibilities

he Candidate will provide full-stack development consulting to a Department of the Army client as part of a Digital Transformation team responsible for harnessing, cleaning, and analyzing large amounts of related data and providing an intuitive and user-friendly set of data visualization dashboards and applications based on this data, to foster a data-driven decision-making approach. The team follows an Agile/Scrum methodology, iterating rapidly in 2-week sprints and constantly engaging with the client for feedback, quickly transforming that feedback into formal requirements.

We seek candidates with extensive knowledge of and hands‐on experience with modern Business Intelligence software with proven ability to work independently in converting business and functional requirements into complex reports, data visualizations and dashboards.

The individual will be the lead data scientist on the team, consulting with the client in the development of intuitive and user-friendly data visualization dashboards and applications.

Initially, team tasks will include importing data into a visualization engine from various external sources and the development of other web-based query applications. Ultimately, the client seeks a consulting team that is software agnostic and possesses a strategic outlook that produces relevant, timely, and actionable technical advice (e.g., advice regarding Digital Transformation of Portfolio Management, Product Support Management, Financial Management, and Contract Management workflows)


Qualifications

The following qualifications are REQUIRED to be considered for this role:
Required Minimum Years of Experience: 5+ Years
Minimum Degree Required: Bachelor’s degree
Clearance Required: U.S. citizenship and ability to obtain a Secret Clearance
The following experience/education/skills are PREFERRED to be considered for this role:

Degree Preferred: Bachelor’s degree in a science, technology, math, engineering field preferred; humanities degree with equivalent technical experience acceptable

Experience Preferred:
Demonstrates experience in performing software or data science development efforts with clear examples of value added to the client
Experience implementing and automating software models created by data science teams (i.e. Spark, Scala, Hive, Python, R, SQL, etc.)
Experience with common data science tools, such as R, Python, MATLAB; with a heavy emphasis on Python.
Demonstrates experience interacting with end-users to understand and document business and functional requirements for complex projects, as well as collaborating with technical teams across the full software development life cycle
Demonstrates considerable proven knowledge of analytical, organizational, planning and project management specific to software development lifecycle processes, which may include the following:
Designing and implementing technology for new or existing business applications.
Developing systems requirements, designing, and prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures, and implementing practical business solutions under weekly and monthly deadlines.
Problem solving capabilities demonstrated in a team context to debug, troubleshoot complex software orchestrations, and/or identify solution options.
Experience scoping and estimating individual tasks, as well as performing on multiple tasks with minimal supervision.
Ability to collect, organize, manage, and process client’s sources of information and enhance data collection procedures.
Understanding of the processing, cleaning, and verification of data used for analysis and ad-hoc analysis.
Ability to perform verification, validation, and fault detection of data models
Applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.

Additional Requirements

The successful candidate must not be subject to employment restrictions from a former employer (such as a non-compete) that would prevent the candidate from performing the job responsibilities as described.

Overview:
DATA SCIENTIST
(HYBRID – BOSTON; NEW YORK; WASHINGTON, D.C.; CHICAGO, SAN FRANCISCO, SILICON VALLEY, LOS ANGELES)

ABOUT CORNERSTONE RESEARCH

We are one of the premier economic consulting firms in the US and Europe. We provide economic and financial expertise to attorneys, corporations, and government agencies involved in complex litigation. These litigation matters may span a wide variety of topics including securities, mergers, antitrust, fraud, or discrimination. We consistently work on the most prominent cases involving Fortune 500 companies and government agencies (e.g. SEC, DOJ, ECB, etc.) in the United States and European Union.

We work collaboratively with academics and experts in economics, data science, machine learning, statistics, finance, marketing, accounting, and healthcare. Our collaborative teams span eight offices and total over 700 full-time employees.

ABOUT THE TEAM

The Data Science Center at Cornerstone Research is a tight knit but growing group of Data Scientists and Data Engineers. We are tasked with streamlining and innovating all data work at Cornerstone Research. Collectively, we build and maintain databases and infrastructure, data pipelines, ML and NLP models, data viz, and internal packages in Python/R. We also automate redundant processes, set standards for all code and Git across the firm, and act as internal consultants for all things data. Our ultimate goal is to use the best software, models and practices to deliver high-quality analysis in the cleanest, streamlined, and accurate manner possible. Some examples of the work the team has done to answer specific questions in the past include:
Fine-tuning the Detectron2 ML model to identify specific products inside of hundreds ofthousands of images found across social media – were influencers promoting the use of adangerous product?
Creating novel geospatial data visualizations of industry concentrations in particular regions ofthe United States – were there opportunities for monopolistic behavior among merging firms?
Developing API pipelines from dozens of public and private sources to collect economic, financial,legal, and healthcare data – how can our team automate relevant data collection so we can focusmore of our time on meaningful modeling and analysis?
Building semi-supervised NLP models to categorize free-form text found among millions ofTwitter posts – were adult brands targeting minors in a harmful way?

POSITION SUMMARY

Data Scientists at Cornerstone are generalists (https://e2eml.school/data_science_archetypes.html). Some of us have stronger skills in text mining and NLP, others in DevOps or geospatial analysis. But all of us have proficiency across data engineering/ETLs, data manipulation, data analysis, and machine learning. These shared skills are used to deliver high quality data products to our experts and consulting teams to cut through data complexities and clarify the most reissues underlying major litigation disputes or investigations. The vast majority of our technical work is done in SQL, R, Python, and AWS. Our team occasionally uses other languages like SAS, STATA, MATLAB, and C++ if client needs for these languages arise.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Hard skills
Ingest, explore, clean, build, sample, and prepare data from clients and public sources
Engineer data pipelines and execute ETL flows from large client data transfers and web APIs
Develop econometric, statistical, and ML models to predict and analyze data
Build packages to automate repetitive workflows through reusable code
Work with structured and unstructured data (e.g. financial records, free form text, JSON,images, geospatial telemetry, social media posts, retail transactions, clinical trials, etc.)
Use and expand scripts/packages for text mining, ML, data visualization, geospatial analysis,web data collection, social media analytics, and advanced statistics and simulations.

Soft Skills
Respond efficiently and effectively to varying client needs, often with little lead time
Communicate clearly with and work closely alongside other team members and consultantsAct as technical lead for groups of analysts in all data and coding work for case teams
Mentor more junior analysts in coding and Git best practices
Proactively seek out opportunities to automate or package up programmatic solutions torepetitive problems
Work with autonomy and independence while managing time appropriately

QUALIFICATIONS

Hard Skills
MA/MS, preferably in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or related field, or equivalent experience.
3+ years professional experience solving complex quantitative problems on large datasets with SQL and Python/R.
Strong proficiency in all of the following: Python, R, SQL, Git, Linux/Unix/Bash/Shell
Experience applying machine learning and NLP models and algorithms to real world data.

Soft Skills
Client Service: Effectively anticipate, monitor, and meet the needs of internal and externalclients by delivering a high-quality product. Ability to solve both clear and ambiguousproblems with moderate guidance.
Business Acumen: Understand Cornerstone’s financial and operational functions. Alignservices and performance of self and team with Cornerstone’s strategic goals.
Communication: Communicate effectively and professionally with colleagues, clients andvendors.
Leadership: Demonstrate a strong commitment to Cornerstone’s values and strategicgoals. Serve as a role model and promote a positive work environment. Demonstratedinterest and aptitude for mentoring and teaching programming skills.

Nice to Haves (any are a plus!)
Experience building software and cloud infrastructure using principles of CI/CD
Experience using AWS for data storage, analysis, and visualization (S3, Redshift, EC2, etc.)
Experience with Spark (or other parallel processing tools like Netezza, Teradata, Greenplum, Aster Data, or Vertica).
Experience developing and testing packages in Python and R.
Familiarity with C, C++, C#, Ruby, Java, and/or JavaScript.
Familiarity with SAS, STATA, MATLAB, Octave, or Julia.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Cornerstone Research is an equal employee opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or other factors protected by law.

To Apply
To apply, please email your resume and a cover letter expressing your interest to Julia Zhang (JZhang@cornerstone.com)

Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)

Optum Labs is the research and development arm of UnitedHealth Group. We're a diverse team of curious thinkers and experts in big data, artificial intelligence and machine learning, and scientific and clinical research searching for new ways to help people live healthier lives. We partner with world leaders in health care delivery, research, and technology to create disruptive solutions that serve patients, caregivers, providers, and commercial and government payers.



More equitable, effective, and affordable health care - that's our goal. We aren't just trying to improve the care an individual receives. We're building a future where the health care system works better for everyone.



You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.

Primary Responsibilities:

Work alongside other data scientists, engineers, and project managers to design and implement models and experiments from end to end, including data ingestion and preparation, feature engineering, analysis and modeling, model deployment, performance tracking and documentation

Improve and extend the analytic methods in our products

Conduct hands-on data analysis and predictive analytics on large and complex datasets

Effectively communicate complex technical results to business partners

Support and drive analytic efforts around machine learning and innovation

Work with a great deal of autonomy to find solutions to complex problems

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Biostatistics, Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Statistics or related technical field

2+ years of hands-on experience in data science and machine learning (specific areas of interest include anomaly detection, time-series/sequence models, NLP, uncertainty quantification, explainability methods,deep learning]

Demonstrable experience with advanced data science tools such as Python, Spark, SQL

Experience implementing predictive algorithms and associated statistical analysis/inference in a data science/ML workflow manipulating both structured and unstructured data

Experience breaking down and converting business problems into data science/ML specification

Demonstrable interest (or experience) in writing high-quality code which converts software engineering critics into your best buddies

Experience communicating highly technical results to a diverse audience

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with deploying ML models in Azure, AWS, and/or Google Cloud

Expertise in healthcare data, e.g. medical and pharmacy claims, EMR/clinical data, lab data, etc.

Experience with agile product development

Experience breaking down and clearly defining problems

Experience with Github

Love for doing the right, hard and often dirty things e.g. code refactoring, cleaning data, helping team before helping yourself

Senior Workforce Planning Analyst / Data Scientist
**$75K - $115K/year**
*Direct Hire, 100% remote role**

Job Description:
Our customer is looking for a passionate, experienced senior workforce planning analyst/data scientist who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Our customer is committed and passionate about helping our federal clients better understand the needs of their workforce and support their critical operational priorities for HR. We help them transform their processes, data and systems to make better decisions for their organization - all while supporting agency missions.
This is an opportunity to work for a company that has the feel of a technology start-up yet has the strength and support of an established firm. We care about the personal success of and invests in the professional development of our employees.
Join a growing team of dedicated professionals that will challenge you to do the best work of your life.
As a member of the Workforce Solutions team the senior workforce planning analyst/data scientist position supports projects and workstreams that help organizations manage data and develop standard reports that enable evaluation and optimization of business performance and operations. Critical components of this position include supporting the development and delivery of strategies, project approaches, deliverables, and recommendations and performing research and analysis. This person will also support the development of databases and rigorous methods of analysis that meet the needs of diverse clientele.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Work with federal agency on developing a robust recruiting analytics program to track, measure, and identify candidates to be hired in the agency.
Oversee the collection, preparation, and management of client data and publicly available government survey datasets.
Design rigorous study protocols for client projects and deliverables.
Conduct analyses of population survey and human resources data, including descriptive and inferential statistical tests (T-test, ANOVA Chi-Square, Pearson Correlation, linear and logistic regression, etc.).
Train junior employees in methods and techniques of quantitative social science.
Lead the development of reports for diverse clientele and according to established protocols.
Lead a project workstream, work collaboratively with team members, prioritize work assignments and execute next steps.
Support ongoing and new development of Innovative Tools and Analytics (IT&A).
Use project management frameworks to track, maintain, and carry out key client activities.
Prepare for and lead client meetings, internal meetings, and working sessions.

Required Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree and 4+ years of experience, or a MA/PhD in social science or statistics.
US Citizenship is required.

Your growth:
Our customer is dedicated to helping you grow professionally. We want to help you learn and grow throughout your career. We do this by aligning your personal development with our customer's growth, and ongoing communication between you and your supervisor to ensure alignment.

The EO specifies that agencies should require all employees and Contractors, with exceptions only as required by law, to be fully vaccinated. Our customer is issuing this guidance on hiring actions to assist in implementing the Executive Order and Task Force’s guidance.

Leading edge technology in an industry that is improving the lives of millions. Positions in this function are responsible for the management and manipulation of mostly structured data, with a focus on building business intelligence tools, conducting analysis to distinguish patterns and recognize trends, performing normalization operations and assuring data quality. Depending on the specific role and business line, example responsibilities in this function could include creating specifications to bring data into a common structure, creating product specifications and models, developing data solutions to support analyses, performing analysis, interpreting results, developing actionable insights and presenting recommendations for use across the company. Roles in this function could partner with stakeholders to understand data requirements and develop tools and models such as segmentation, dashboards, data visualizations, decision aids and business case analysis to support the organization. Other roles involved could include producing and managing the delivery of activity and value analytics to external stakeholders and clients. Team members will typically use business intelligence, data visualization, query, analytic and statistical software to build solutions, perform analysis and interpret data. Positions in this function work on predominately descriptive and regression-based analytics and tend to leverage subject matter expert views in the design of their analytics and algorithms. This function is not intended for employees performing the following work: production of standard or self-service operational reporting, casual inference led (healthcare analytics) or data pattern recognition (data science) analysis; and/or image or unstructured data analysis using sophisticated theoretical frameworks.
This is an exciting role in the growing Optum Care Services division within UnitedHealth Group. The ideal candidate is passionate about working with data and driven to deliver creative and compelling solutions and analytic results which turn data into actionable insights for our business. The prospective Senior Data Analyst will support the organization in identifying key trend components of the Care Services population, disease conditions, utilization, gap analysis, and assure data quality. This role requires analysis experience and ability to work with large data sets, interpret results, and develop clinical analytic outcomes highlighting the value of several Optum Care Services programs as well as answer key business questions to drive business strategy.
You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.
General Profile:
Reviews the work of others
Develops innovative approaches
Sought out as expert
Serves as a leader/ mentor
Job Scope:
Anticipates customer needs and proactively develops solutions to meet them
Serves as a key resource on complex and/or critical issues
Solves complex problems and develops innovative solutions
Performs complex conceptual analyses
Reviews work performed by others and provides recommendations for improvement
Forecasts and plans resource requirements
Authorizes deviations from standards
May lead functional or segment teams or projects
Provides explanations and information to others on the most complex issues
Motivates and inspires other team members
Primary Responsibilities:
Identify key trends in member demographics, disease prevalence, and utilization to support the creation of member specific strategies to ensure coding accuracy
Study APC level diagnostic patterns to identify opportunities for increased documentation accuracy
Support Care Services program growth through identification of new opportunities
Demonstrate a solid understanding of project scope, data extraction methodology, logic and design of data cleaning, exploratory data analysis, and statistical methods
Works with less structured data, able to merge data from different sources and perform data scrubbing prior to analysis to show clinical outcomes highlighting program impact and value
Use business intelligence, data visualization, query, analytic and statistical software to build solutions, perform analysis and interpret data
Able to write and understand SQL/SAS queries to leverage existing standardized calculations of metrics and perform in depth statistical analysis and interpret data
Work effectively both as an individual analytic contributor and collaborator within the team

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.
Required Qualifications:
Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience
5+ years of working knowledge of relational databases, database structures (SQL, Oracle, Teradata)
3+ years of experience developing in business intelligence/visualization software (preferably Tableau or Power BI)
3+ Healthcare Industry or related claims experience
Intermediate level of proficiency developing SAS/SQL queries
Intermediate level of proficiency with MS Office Suite (Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Word)
Preferred Qualifications:
Healthcare risk adjustment experience
Patient clinical management data experience
Excellent critical thinking and problem problem-solving skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills

The Data Science and Optimization team is responsible for development of industry-leading analytics solutions to enable a roadmap that drives the technology development & innovation, while delivering high-quality and high-value solutions. This position will be reporting to the Senior Manager of Data Science.
The Sr. Data scientist will leverage their deep technical and institutional expertise to drive ML solutions in payor relations and retail analytics while developing products:
That optimize the drug prices at 9700+ pharmacy locations
That enhance customer experience in our retail pharmacy stores.

The ideal candidate should have deep AI/ML expertise and a collaborative mindset to inspire the team, align cross-functional stakeholders, and deliver efficient result. They should be able to leverage technology to engage with business stakeholders across the enterprise to work on new applications of data science in payor relations domain. They would be responsible for routine testing of ML solutions to ensure results are consistent with business requirements.
We are looking for a candidate that has an ownership mindset to lead a workstream with minimal supervision and has the energy to inspire new initiatives by applying state-of-the art ML/AI and optimization techniques for generating higher impact.
The candidate must be experienced in developing end to end solutions across the data science product pipelines with adequate knowledge in fields of data engineering, ML modeling, visualization, server deployments, distributed database management, MLOps and statistics.
Responsibilities include

Lead development of complex ML pipelines and statistical models to grow business value by improving our pricing operations
Leverage technology depth to engage with key leaders across the enterprise to identify new applications of artificial intelligence in payor relations
Gather business requirements from various stakeholders and lead analysis of massive datasets to synthesize strategies and tactics to solve complex problems
Conduct or coordinate appropriate testing of data/ML solutions to ensure results are consistent with business expectations
Present and communicate meaningful insights obtained from ML model results to technical and non-technical audiences including internal stakeholders and senior leadership

Pay Range
The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 75,000
Maximum: 167,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.

Required Qualifications
3+ years of relevant experience working in data science with a track record of delivering insights and business impact
3+ years of experience with advanced machine learning techniques, such as deep learning, natural language processing, computer vision and reinforcement learning.
3+ years of expertise using data science, programming, and visualization tools such as Snowflake, SQL, cloud-based ML Ops tech stack and Tableau
Ability to engage with senior business stakeholders, execute level communication and influencing skills
Highly motivated individual willing to upskill with an ability to work in an extremely fast paced environment both individually and with a team.
Prior experience using and managing projects leveraging Cloud technologies (Azure, GCP, AWS, Databricks)
Expert level programming skills in Python or R

COVID Requirements

COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement
CVS Health requires certain colleagues to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, religious belief, or other legally recognized reasons that prevents them from being vaccinated.

You are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status or apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 10 days of your employment. Please note that in some states and roles, you may be required to provide proof of full vaccination or an approved reasonable accommodation before you can begin to actively work.

Preferred Qualifications
Strong analytics and data skills including solid training in statistics and data analysis, understanding of data management and visualization, ability to interpret outcomes of machine learning models
Domain expertise in time series analysis, demand forecasting and pricing analytics having mastered the techniques across spectrum of complexity – Tree based models, ARIMA, deep learning based time series models.
3+ years of hand-on experience building neural networks in Tensorflow, Pytorch or Keras for processing structured and unstructured data for applications across industry domains.
Expertise in application of optimization techniques (Mixed Integer, Linear Programimg) and simulation.
Robust data management and reporting skills, understanding of deploying machine learning models in real time production environments including cloud (Azure, AWS, GCP), Spark-based systems, etc.
Highest level of attention to detail when working within legal and compliance
regulations, primarily around HIPAA, patient safety work product, and attorney/client privilege while working with sensitive, confidential, and protected data.

Education
Bachelor’s Degree required
Master’s degree or PhD in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or related STEM field is preferred.

Business Overview
Bring your heart to CVS Health
Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver.

Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable.
We strive to promote and sustain a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging every day.

Overview:
The American quick lube industry provides more than 100 million oil changes every year from over 10,000 standalone locations. Within this industry, there is one dynamic growing company that stands out from the rest – Team Car Care, dba Jiffy Lube, the largest franchisee of quick lube retail service stores in the country. Operating more than 500 Jiffy Lube locations from coast to coast, serving nearly 5 million guests each year with over 5,000 professional service advisors, Team Car Care’s mission is to be the most trusted car care company in the nation. We strive to do this by exceeding guests' expectations with consistent service delivered through our team of friendly, knowledgeable, professional, trustworthy teammates. Our values guide all our actions and include respect, integrity, teamwork, trust and excellence. Team Car Care is a portfolio company of Wynnchurch Capital.

Position Summary
Provides data-based business insights to capture opportunities and solve business problems utilizing database and customer information. This is achieved through analysis, modeling, and statistics. Ability to summarize analysis results/learning’s in a clear and concise matter. Able to develop proformas and post analysis of all marketing and sales programs at the store, district and division level using sales data and media spend, building analytical tools to calculate ROAS on all advertising spend. The Senior Data Analyst will play a vital role in developing and executing Team Car Care/Jiffy Lube’s analytics through the scientific method to test, measure and implement new strategies.

Primary Responsibilities Includes
30% analytics to allocate marketing spend, e.g., media spend modeling, marketing ROAS/ROI, etc.
30% customer analysis, e.g., segmentation, product mix, customer profiling, and CAC/LTV analysis to target customers for conversion and retention to help grow the business
40% ad-hoc/other, e.g., pricing, A-B testing, market testing, sales initiatives, etc.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree and 3-5 years of experience in analytics, consulting, or similar fields.
Advanced Excel modeling skills as well as ability to query large databases using SQL
Experience with statistical modeling using tools such as R or Python
Ability to connect the dots to tell a story leading to actionable insights using statistics and data
Preferred Qualification
Growth marketing analytics for consumer products and services (B2C), including retail, services, etc.
Experience measuring marketing campaigns using ROAS to improve spend efficiency
Excellent communication and presentation skills working with multiple levels of management
Ability to build and manage complex models with limited resources and time
Ability to manage multiple tasks at once and a strong work ethic based on a desire to exceed expectations
Detail-oriented and data-driven, with a sharp focus on quality
Workday PRISM Analytics experience a plus

Must be authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship for at least 2 years.

You will analyze data related to the firm's technology assets and control processes and become a subject matter expert in the Technology Control and Regulatory Assessment data ecosystem. You will develop data driven and exploratory analysis techniques that assist management's risk and control decision-making processes. The successful candidate will focus on developing approaches which drive how the firm determines the relative risk that an application presents to the firm's business processes and how reference data can be used to continuously measure the adoption and operation of technology controls.

You will also work with various program and system of record owners to ensure that the program's analyses and analytics are utilizing high-quality data. There will be opportunities to explore the feasibility of leveraging machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques to further the program's goals and objectives.

Responsibilities :
Understand business requirements and identify opportunities to improve data quality enhance how data is used for decision support.
Provide business requirements to product owners and engineering to further the program's data needs and data quality, driving to satisfy self-serve and dashboard driven reporting with data source transparency and quality.
Ensure data used in performing analyses is of sufficient quality to effectively support informed decision making and timely analysis.
Collaborate with product and engineering teams to develop techniques to evaluate the quality of data. In some cases, this may include developing tactical approaches that allow the Data Analytics team to monitor quality of key data.
Conducts strategic data analysis identifies insights, implications and make strategic recommendations, develops data visualization that clearly communicate the analysis.
Establish a strong collaborative relationship and be able to drive ad-hoc projects effectively.
Apply expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining and the presentation of the data to see beyond the numbers and under how our business stake interact with the analytics.
Deliver concise communication detailing the progress and results of initiative underway.
Qualifications :

At least 2 years of experience in one of more of the following fields: information risk management, data management and analysis, cybersecurity, risk assessments, operational risk, IT control environments and Project Management.
Experience in any of the following areas: data warehousing, exploratory data analysis, data extraction and visualization
Hands-on data experience of query development of basic to moderate complexity using (T-SQL/SQL) or other coding language.
Hands- on experience of data mining techniques including basic data modeling, trend analysis and root cause analysis using Alteryx.
Using user interface / User experience design concept and leading market visualization tools such as (Tableau, Power BI)
Working Knowledge of API using analytical tools such as SQL / Alteryx or related tools.
Able to pass an extensive background check to access specific data sets when required
Experience developing quantitative and qualitative risk and control evaluation algorithms
Ability to develop strong client and working relationships with a globally distributed team
Ability to adapt to changing requirements and priorities and deliver when deadlines with critical items are assigned
Ability to effectively organize and prioritize work
Experience with agile methodologies and Jira.
ISACA CRISC certification preferred; CISA certification is a plus

Janssen Research & Development LLC, a Johnson & Johnson company, is recruiting for the Associate Director of DS Portfolio Management and Analytics. This role will help us bring cutting-edge standard DS analytics to power the Feasibility and other clinical trial processes for Therapeutic areas, Global Development, and clinical team at Janssen! The role will report to the Director, DS Portfolio Management and Analytics.
Role Overview-You will:
Strategize and Manage DS Analytic Portfolio Execution of TA focused Program and Study DS feasibility analytics
Develop partnerships with cross functional teams including but not limited to DS teams, TA, Medical Affairs, GD (PDO, GCO, FCOE) and external stakeholders to identify robust and efficient methods to perform the analytical packages
Drive strategic initiatives to maintain standardization and increase the scalability of DS capability, tooling and organizational infrastructure
Be the DS Portfolio Management point representative for TA to optimize supply/demand, prioritization across the capability, maximizing productivity and timely delivery of meaningful insights
Manage and Oversee therapeutic area aligned team of DS Analytics Managers and cross-functional, matrixed team including resourcing and performance management

Drive innovation to industrialize standard analytics and ascertain value-added insight generation for clinical trial development and execution in close collaboration with cross functional teams in JRD DS and beyond
Establish a portfolio driven approach to deliver Feasibility strategy and related investments
Lead and work cross team to deliver E2E Program level Core feasibility analytic package including coordinating the execution, compilation of analytics and insights
Use analytics tools, data science, clinical trial experience as well as epidemiological and health outcomes experience to perform standard analytics and interpretation in the clinical trial feasibility and operational insights space
Partner with JRD DS teams to understand cutting edge RWE based advanced analytics to support feasibility and clinical trial process
Represent the DS Portfolio Management team to drive infrastructure/tool enhancements and changes to capability technology in collaboration with GD, EBIS, IT, JCI, and other technology representatives
Drive the functional performance of the Feasibility and clinical trial capability in terms of both business satisfaction and successful relationships across Global Development and TA

A minimum of a Master’s degree or PhD in Quantitative discipline or data-heavy sciences (physics, genetics, biology, data engineering) or related is preferred
Expert in clinical trial operational datasets and understanding of deriving operational benchmarks
Experience in working with Real World data (claims, lab, etc.) and AI/ML outcomes
Confident working independently, with limited guidance, self-reliant with the ability to deliver robust, timely, high-quality analytics
Experience in strategizing, leading and managing complex analytical projects
Excellent communicator with great PowerPoint skills, regularly construct compelling slides, and deliver focused, concise, clear and timely data and technology assessments to leadership team
3+ years of industry experience in relevant roles such as information sciences, data management, clinical trial feasibility, and or similar with a proven track record of success for driving forward large initiatives by generating buy-in, managing complex projects, and continuously completing excellent quality analytics is required
At least 2+ years of experience managing teams
Experience working with analytical tools, large datasets, understanding of data analysis workflows
Excel, SQL or related programming experience and expert at pulling and assessing data assets for operational data analytics
Working knowledge of the changing ecosystem of external data such as real-world data, and publicly available data assets that would benefit a clinical operations data science team
Experience or deep understanding with data science and analytics, especially machine learning, data analytics, decision science, operations research and clinical trial feasibility, data modeling, and/or data engineering
This position may require up to 15% domestic or international travel

Job summary Does serving ads to billions of search requests daily and finding the most relevant ads for a search page from billions of ads in 10s of milliseconds excite you? The Sponsored Products Search Sourcing team owns finding the appropriate ads to surface to customers when they search for products on Amazon. We strive to understand our customers’ intent and identify relevant ads which enable them to discover new and alternate products. This also enables sellers on Amazon to showcase their products to customers, which may at times be buried deeper in the search results. Our systems and algorithms operate on one of the world's largest product catalogs, matching shoppers with products - with a strict latency constraints. We are a team of machine learning scientists and software engineers working on complex solutions to understand the customer intent and present them with ads that are not only relevant to their actual shopping experience, but also non-obtrusive. This area is of strategic importance to Amazon Retail and Marketplace business, driving long term-growth. We are looking for a Software Engineer, who can drive appropriate technology choices for the business, lead the way for continuous innovation, and shape the future of ad serving on Amazon search. You will build services to handle billions of requests per day, while maintaining response latencies in milliseconds and meeting strict SLA requirements. It is quite routine for our systems to operate on massive datasets using distributed frameworks. You will design and code, troubleshoot, and support high volume and low latency distributed systems. The solutions you create would drive step increases in coverage of sponsored ads across the retail website and ensure relevant ads are served to Amazon's customers. You will directly impact our customers’ shopping experience, increase advertiser's ROAS, and improve long-term monetization. This role will provide exposure to cutting-edge innovations in product search, vector search, natural language processing (NLP), deep learning, and reinforcement learning. In addition to being a strongly motivated IC, you will also be responsible for mentoring junior engineers and guiding them to deliver high impacting products and services for Amazon customers and sellers.
Experience in building large-scale machine-learning infrastructure for online recommendation, ads ranking, personalization, or search, etc.
Experience with Big Data technologies such as AWS, Hadoop, Spark, Pig, Hive, Lucene/SOLR or Storm/Samza
Strong proficiency with Java, Python, Scala or C++
Coursework or thesis in machine learning, data mining, information retrieval, statistics or natural language processing
Advanced knowledge of performance, scalability, enterprise system architecture, and engineering best practices
3+ years professional experience in software development
3+ years experience with computer science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis

ABOUT THE TEAM

The CCB Business Modeling Center of Excellence consists of an intellectually diverse team of economists, statisticians, engineers, and other analytics professionals, focused on applied AI and quantitative modeling within CCB at JPMorgan Chase & Co. The team answers complex and unique questions, utilizing cutting edge quantitative and computational techniques and leverage one of the world's largest repositories of consumer data. We partner with teams across JPMC to assess and execute critical business decisions and engage in work in a variety of business domains that leverage knowledge in at least one of the following areas:
Time-Series (e.g. Seasonal Decomposition, ARIMAX, Vector Autoregression
Optimization (e.g. MIP, Non-linear, Black-Box)
Classification (e.g. Probit/Logit, Logistic Regression)
Tree-Based Frameworks (e.g. Random Forest, Gradient Boosting)
Deep Learning (e.g. CNN, LSTM, Transformers)
Artificial Intelligence (e.g. Reinforcement Learning, Natural Language Understanding)

As an Applied AI ML VP in our CCB Business Modeling Center of Excellence Operations team you will work in a variety of business domains such as Cash Logistics, Collections, Service and Complaints, and IVR personalization and NLU. Members can also contribute to the development of cutting-edge infrastructure and automation as part of the Applied AI domain.

As an Applied AI ML VP some of your responsibilities are:
Apply critical thinking skills and perform advanced analytics with the goal of solving complex and multi-faceted business problems.
Generate deep insights through the analysis of data and understanding of business processes and turn them into actionable recommendations.
Contribute to the full modeling lifecycle, including defining the objective and key decision variables, choosing appropriate methodologies, performing advanced quantitative and statistical analysis of large datasets, and communicating results.
Develop presentations to summarize and communicate key messages to senior management, sponsors and colleagues.
Become a subject matter expert and trusted advisor in the statistical, optimization and/or machine learning modeling discipline.
Actively contribute to the continuous learning mindset of the organization by bringing in new ideas and perspectives that stretch the thinking of the group.
Mentor junior team members.

Minimum Qualifications for this role:
Advanced degree in Statistics, Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Operations Research, Mathematics, or equivalent quantitative field. Ph.D. is a plus.
Outstanding written and oral communication skills to present analytical findings and exercise influence among key project stakeholders.
Experience in developing machine learning, optimization, and/or statistical models to solve real world problems (e.g. Classification, Regression, Recommender Systems, Natural Language Processing, or Neural Language Modeling).
Proficiency in SQL and at least one programming language is required, with Python preferred.
Strong analytical, interpretive, and problem-solving skills, with demonstrated ability of thinking outside the box.
Significant experience working with very large scale (structured and unstructured) data.
5+ years of related experience preferred.

The following experiences are preferred, but not required:
Familiarity with big-data environments (e.g. Hadoop, Spark).
Model development experience on a cloud development platform.
Banking & Financial Services background or experience.

Requisition Id 8995
Overview:
The Multiscale Methods and Dynamics (MMD) Group at Oak Ridge National Laboratory (ORNL) is seeking qualified applicants for a postdoctoral position in machine learning and data analysis. Areas of interest include graph neural networks, federated learning, PDE-based construction and analysis of neural networks, data-driven model reduction, and randomized algorithms. The position comes with a travel allowance and access to advanced computing resources. The MMD group is responsible for the design and development of basic numerical algorithms and analysis necessary for simulating and understanding complex, multi-scale systems. The group is part of the Mathematics in Computation (MiC) Section of the Computer Science and Mathematics (CSM) Division. CSM delivers fundamental and applied research capabilities in a wide range of areas, including applied mathematics and computer science, experimental computing systems, scalable algorithms and systems, artificial intelligence and machine learning, data management, workflow systems, analysis and visualization technologies, programming systems and environments, and system science and engineering. The successful candidate will collaborate heavily with members of the Dana Analytics and Machine Learning (DAML) group, which is also a part of the MiC Section

Major Duties and Responsibilities:
Participation in the development and analysis of new computational methodologies for scientific problems, often customized to complex and large-scale scientific applications
Delivery and support of mathematical technologies for various scientific disciplines and applications
Dissemination of research through peer-reviewed papers and technical reports, as well as seminar and conference presentation
Active participation in professional organizations

Basic Qualifications:
A Ph.D. in Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, Computational Science, or a related field completed within the last 5 years
Experience working with modern machine learning software tools and frameworks
Demonstrated written and oral communication skills
Effective interpersonal skills

Preferred Qualifications:
Formal training in numerical analysis, numerical linear algebra, and/or iterative solvers
Expertise in model reduction and surrogates
Experience developing mathematical tools for engineering or science applications
Experience in the design and implementation of scalable numerical algorithms on HPC architectures

Submission Instructions:
Please submit a cover letter, curriculum vitae, research statement, and three letters of reference when applying to this position.
Please have letters sent to recruiting@ornl.gov with the Job Posting Title and Requisition ID Number in the subject line.
Applicants should submit all materials by November 15st, 2022, but review of applications will begin immediately.

To upload documents to your candidate profile:
login to your account via jobs.ornl.gov
view Profile
under the My Documents section, select Add a Document

Applicants cannot have received their Ph.D. more than five years prior to the date of application and must complete all degree requirements before starting their appointment. The appointment length will be for up to 24 months with the potential for extension. Initial appointments and extensions are subject to performance and the availability of funding.

Benefits at ORNL:
ORNL offers competitive pay and benefits programs to attract and retain talented people. The laboratory offers many employee benefits, including medical and retirement plans and flexible work hours, to help you and your family live happy and healthy. Employee amenities such as on-site fitness, banking, and cafeteria facilities are also provided for convenience. Other benefits include: Prescription Drug Plan, Dental Plan, Vision Plan, 401(k) Retirement Plan, Contributory Pension Plan, Life Insurance, Disability Benefits, Generous Vacation and Holidays, Parental Leave, Legal Insurance with Identity Theft Protection, Employee Assistance Plan, Flexible Spending Accounts, Health Savings Accounts, Wellness Programs, Educational Assistance, Relocation Assistance, and Employee Discounts.

Implement Risk Management Processes by facilitating the Risk Management Board, coordinating risk assessments with stakeholders, maintaining mitigation action plans, and providing reports to inform leadership of current program risk posture on a regular basis.
Apply Data analytics processes within standard toolsets in a manner that enables efficient and effective response to changing mission needs and rapidly evolving system requirements.
Lead the managing of software interface requirements and definitions

Experience in software development environments utilizing Agile methodology.
Experience implementing Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning algorithms into software projects.
Experience in one or more areas among: Machine Learning - Time-series models, Deep Learning / Reinforcement Learning, Causal Inference, Statistics.
Support our Agile/Scrum process through backlog management
Experience with leading data science projects from conception to production.

Software Engineer-Machine Learning & Vision Platform

Precision Planting is an innovative company that is changing the agriculture industry in remarkable ways. In only twenty years, we have helped redefine agriculture in the US and globally. Our products make growers more productive, increase yields, and current agricultural practices more sustainable, and reduce the costs to feed a growing world. Precision Planting is growing rapidly and has many new products and business opportunities it is pursuing to continue that growth. We are entrepreneurial in our DNA, fast-paced in our actions, and value hard work, innovative thinking, open communications, and teamwork. If you share these values, then we might be the right place for you to contribute, grow and succeed in your career.

About the Role:
In this role, you will help to develop the software platform that is being used to deploy machine learning and computer vision models to our embedded vision module. This platform will be used to deliver the next generation of sensing and control capabilities to our 20|20 system. As an engineer, you will play a critical role in determining how the latest technology can be used to help farmers, and own the feature development for several key customer-facing product features.

What would I be doing?
Writing C++ and Python code to build and enhance the framework that is used to develop, and deploy Computer Vision, and Deep Learning applications.
Turn proof-of-concept ideas into production-quality products
Configure and optimize Linux for use with custom-designed embedded hardware
Developing control, monitoring, and display systems in C++
Opportunities to develop on agricultural equipment and experience our products first-hand

What must I have?
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering
3+ years of professional software development experience in modern C++
Professional software development experience with Linux
Working knowledge of inter-process communication methods (such as Protobuf, DDS, ZeroMQ, shared memory, etc).
Strong communication skills and experience being a flexible team player

What other specific skills & experiences would be good for me to have?
Experience developing C++ code for a commercial Computer Vision application
GStreamer development experience or similar video processing experience
Experience with open-source frameworks for Computer Vision and Machine Learning applications, such as OpenCV, TensorFlow, PyTorch
Experience optimizing deep learning models using TensorRT, cuDNN, DeepStream, etc.
Exposure to modern C++ code with an emphasis on C++17 and C++20
Experience working with multi-threaded and near real-time systems
Hands on experience with Yocto, Kernel configuration, Boot loaders, Device Trees, and Cross compiling.
